<EFX_FORWARD_LOOK>
<A NAME="FIS_FORWARD_LOOK"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 18PT">
<B>
	FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Certain statements made herein, including statements relating to matters that are not historical
	facts and statements of our beliefs, intentions and expectations about developments, results and
	events which will or may occur in the future, constitute &#147;forward-looking information&#148; within the
	meaning of applicable Canadian securities legislation and &#147;forward-looking statements&#148; within the
	meaning of the &#147;safe harbor&#148; provisions of the United States Private Securities Litigation Reform
	Act of 1995. Forward-looking information and statements are typically identified by words such as
	&#147;anticipate,&#148; &#147;could,&#148; &#147;should,&#148; &#147;expect,&#148; &#147;seek,&#148; &#147;may,&#148; &#147;intend,&#148; &#147;likely,&#148; &#147;plan,&#148; &#147;estimate,&#148;
	&#147;will,&#148; &#147;believe&#148; and similar expressions suggesting future outcomes or statements regarding an
	outlook. These include, but are not limited to, statements respecting anticipated business
	activities; planned expenditures; corporate strategies; proposed acquisitions and dispositions of
	assets; discussions with third parties respecting material agreements; mining plans for the Oyu
	Tolgoi Project and the schedule for carrying out and completing construction of the Oyu Tolgoi
	Project; the estimated schedule and cost of bringing the Oyu Tolgoi Project into commercial
	production; anticipated future production and cash flows; target milling rates; mining plans and
	production forecasts for the Ovoot Tolgoi Coal Mine; the schedule for carrying out and completing
	an expansion of the production capability of the Ovoot Tolgoi Coal Mine; anticipated outcomes with
	respect to the ongoing marketing of coal products from the Ovoot Tolgoi Coal Mine; the anticipated
	timing of payback of capital invested in the Ovoot Tolgoi Coal Mine; the impact of amendments to
	the laws of Mongolia and other countries in which IVN carries on business, particularly with
	respect to taxation; the anticipated timing, cost and outcome of plans to continue the development
	of non-core projects, and other statements that are not historical facts.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	All such forward-looking information and statements are based on certain assumptions and analyses
	made by the Company&#146;s management in light of their experience and perception of historical trends,
	current conditions and expected future developments, as well as other factors management believes
	are appropriate in the circumstances. These statements, however, are subject to a variety of risks
	and uncertainties and other factors that could cause actual events or results to differ materially
	from those
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<A NAME="eolPage3"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	projected in the forward-looking information or statements. Important factors that could cause
	actual results to differ from these forward-looking statements include those described under the
	heading &#147;General Development of the Business &#150; Risk Factors&#148; in the Annual Information Form of the
	Company for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009. The reader is cautioned not to place undue reliance
	on forward-looking information or statements.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	This Annual Report on Form 40-F also contains references to estimates of mineral reserves and
	mineral resources. The estimation of reserves and resources is inherently uncertain and involves
	subjective judgments about many relevant factors. The accuracy of any such estimates is a function
	of the quantity and quality of available data, and of the assumptions made and judgments used in
	engineering and geological interpretation, which may prove to be unreliable. There can be no
	assurance that these estimates will be accurate or that such mineral reserves and mineral resources
	can be mined or processed profitably. Mineral resources that are not mineral reserves do not have
	demonstrated economic viability. Except as required by law, the Company does not assume the
	obligation to revise or update these forward-looking statements after the date of this document or
	to revise them to reflect the occurrence of future unanticipated events.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 18PT">
<B>
	NOTE TO UNITED STATES INVESTORS CONCERNING ESTIMATES OF MEASURED,
<BR>
	INDICATED AND INFERRED RESOURCES
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	This document and the documents incorporated by reference herein have been prepared in accordance
	with the requirements of securities laws in effect in Canada, which differ from the requirements of
	United States securities laws. Without limiting the foregoing, this document, and the documents
	incorporated by reference herein, use the terms &#147;measured,&#148; &#147;indicated&#148; and &#147;inferred&#148; resources.
	United States investors are advised that, while such terms are recognized and required by Canadian
	securities laws, the SEC does not recognize them. Under current United States standards,
	mineralization may not be classified as a &#147;reserve&#148; unless the determination has been made that the
	mineralization could be economically and legally produced or extracted at the time the reserve
	determination is made. United States investors are cautioned not to assume that all or any part of
	measured or indicated resources will ever be converted into reserves. Further, &#147;inferred resources&#148;
	have a great amount of uncertainty as to their existence and as to whether they can be mined
	legally or economically. It cannot be assumed that all or any part of the &#147;inferred resources&#148; will
	ever be upgraded to a higher category. Therefore, United States investors are also cautioned not to
	assume that all or any part of the inferred resources exist, or that they can be mined legally or
	economically. Disclosure of &#147;contained ounces&#148; is permitted disclosure under Canadian regulations;
	however, the SEC only permits issuers to report &#147;resources&#148; as in place tonnage and grade without
	reference to unit measures. Accordingly, information concerning descriptions of mineralization and
	resources contained in this document, or in the documents incorporated by reference, may not be
	comparable to information made public by United States companies subject to the reporting and
	disclosure requirements of the SEC. National Instrument 43-101 Standards of Disclosure for Mineral
	Projects (&#147;NI 43-101&#148;) is a rule developed by the Canadian Securities Administrators that
	establishes standards for all public disclosure an issuer makes of scientific and technical
	information concerning mineral projects. Unless otherwise indicated, all reserve and resource
	estimates contained in or incorporated by reference in this document have been prepared in
	accordance with NI 43-101. These standards differ significantly from the requirements of the SEC,
	and reserve and resource information contained herein and incorporated by reference herein may not
	be comparable to similar information disclosed by U.S. companies. NI 43-101 permits historical
	estimates made prior to the adoption of NI 43-101 that do not comply with NI 43-101 to be disclosed
	using the historical terminology if the disclosure: (a)&nbsp;identifies the source and date of the
	historical estimate; (b)&nbsp;comments on the relevance and reliability of the historical estimate;
	(c)&nbsp;states whether the historical estimate uses categories other than those prescribed by NI
	43-101; and (d)&nbsp;includes any more recent estimates or data available.
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	3
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage4"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 18PT">
<B>
	ADDITIONAL DISCLOSURE
</B>
</DIV>
</EFX_FORWARD_LOOK>
<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	Disclosure Controls and Procedures
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Disclosure controls and procedures are designed to provide reasonable assurance that all relevant
	information is gathered and reported to senior management, including the Company&#146;s principal
	executive officer and principal financial officer, on a timely basis so that appropriate decisions
	can be made regarding public disclosure.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	As of the end of the Company&#146;s fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, an evaluation of the
	effectiveness of the Company&#146;s &#147;disclosure controls and procedures&#148; (as such term is defined in
	Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange
	Act&#148;)) was carried out by the Company&#146;s management with the participation of the principal
	executive officer and principal financial officer. Based upon that evaluation, the Company&#146;s
	principal executive officer and principal financial officer have concluded that as of the end of
	that fiscal year, the Company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures are effective to ensure that
	information required to be disclosed by the Company in reports that it files or submits under the
	Exchange Act is: (i)&nbsp;recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods specified
	in United States Securities and Exchange Commission (&#147;SEC&#148;) rules and forms, and (ii)&nbsp;accumulated
	and communicated to the Company&#146;s management, including its principal executive officer and
	principal financial officer, to allow timely decisions regarding required disclosure.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	It should be noted that while the Company&#146;s principal executive officer and principal financial
	officer believe that the Company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures provide a reasonable level of
	assurance that they are effective, they do not expect that the Company&#146;s disclosure controls and
	procedures or internal control over financial reporting will prevent all errors and fraud. A
	control system, no matter how well conceived or operated, can provide only reasonable, not
	absolute, assurance that the objectives of the control system are met.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	Management&#146;s Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	The required disclosure is included in the Company&#146;s Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis for the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, filed as Exhibit&nbsp;3 of this Annual Report on Form 40-F.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	Changes in Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, there were no changes in the Company&#146;s internal control
	over financial reporting that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially
	affect, the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</DIV>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	ATTESTATION REPORT OF THE REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	The Company&#146;s independent registered chartered accountants, Deloitte &#038; Touche LLP, have issued an
	unqualified opinion on the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting which is included in
	the Company&#146;s Audited Consolidated Financial Statements for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009
	attached hereto as Exhibit&nbsp;2.
</DIV>

<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<EFX_AUDIT_COMMITTEE>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDIT_COMMITTEE"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	AUDIT COMMITTEE
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	The Company&#146;s board of directors has a separately-designated standing Audit Committee as defined by
	Section&nbsp;3(a)(58)(A) of the Exchange Act for the purpose of overseeing the accounting and financial
	reporting processes of the Company and audits of the Company&#146;s annual financial statements. As of
	the date of this annual report, the members of the Audit Committee are Ms.&nbsp;Livia Mahler and Messrs.
	David Korbin, Kjeld Thygesen and Dr.&nbsp;Marcus Faber. Mr.&nbsp;Korbin is the Chairman of the Audit
	Committee.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Each of the directors serving on the Audit Committee has also been determined by the board of the
	Company to be independent within the criteria established by the SEC, the New York Stock Exchange
	(the &#147;NYSE&#148;) and the NASDAQ Stock Market (&#147;Nasdaq&#148;) for audit committee membership.
</DIV>
</EFX_AUDIT_COMMITTEE>
<EFX_AUDIT_COMMITTEE_EXPERT>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDIT_COMMITTEE_EXPERT"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	AUDIT COMMITTEE FINANCIAL EXPERT
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	The Company&#146;s board of directors has determined that Mr.&nbsp;David Korbin is an &#147;audit committee
	financial expert&#148; (as such term is defined in Form 40-F). In addition, Mr.&nbsp;Korbin is independent,
	as that term is defined by the SEC and the NYSE and Nasdaq listing standards. Mr.&nbsp;Korbin holds a
	Chartered Accountant designation and has worked as an accounting professional for over 25&nbsp;years.
</DIV>
</EFX_AUDIT_COMMITTEE_EXPERT>
<EFX_CODE_OF_ETHICS>
<A NAME="FIS_CODE_OF_ETHICS"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	CODE OF BUSINESS CONDUCT AND ETHICS
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	The Company has adopted a written &#147;code of ethics&#148; (as that term is defined in Form 40-F), entitled
	Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, which applies to all of the Company&#146;s employees, executive
	officers and directors, including the Company&#146;s principal executive officer, principal financial
	officer, principal accounting officer or controller, and persons performing similar functions. The
	Code of Business Conduct and Ethics includes, among other things, written standards for the
	Company&#146;s principal executive officer, principal financial officer and principal accounting officer
	that are required by the SEC for a code of ethics applicable to such officers. To review or obtain
	a copy of the Company&#146;s Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, see &#147;Ethics Point &#150; Code of Business
	Conduct and Ethics&#148; posted on the Company&#146;s website, www.ivanhoemines.com. The Code of Business
	Conduct and Ethics is also available in print to any shareholder who requests it. Requests for
	copies of the Code should be made by contacting: Ivanhoe Mines Ltd., 654 &#150; 999 Canada Place,
	Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada V6C 3E1.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Since the adoption of the Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, there have not been any amendments
	to the Code of Business Conduct and Ethics (other than housekeeping amendments to the Code in 2007
	to clarify consulting and reporting procedures and to recognize the Company&#146;s whistleblower
	mechanism) or waivers, including implicit waivers, from any provision of the Code of Business
	Conduct and Ethics.
</DIV>
</EFX_CODE_OF_ETHICS>

</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<U>
	Pre-Approval Policies and Procedures
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	All services to be performed by the Company&#146;s independent auditor must be approved in advance by
	the Audit Committee or a designated member of the Audit Committee (&#147;Designated Member&#148;). The
	Designated Member is a member of the Audit Committee who has been given the authority to grant
	pre-approvals of permitted audit and non-audit services.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	The Audit Committee has considered whether the provision of services other than audit services is
	compatible with maintaining the auditors&#146; independence and has adopted a policy governing the
	provision
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	6
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	of these services. This policy requires the pre-approval by the Audit Committee or the Designated
	Member of all audit and non-audit services provided by the external auditor, other than any de
	minimis non-audit services allowed by applicable law or regulation. The decisions of the
	Designated Member to pre-approve a permitted service needs to be reported to the Audit Committee at
	its regularly scheduled meetings.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Pre-approval from the Audit Committee or Designated Member can be sought for planned engagements
	based on budgeted or committed fees. No further approval is required to pay pre-approved fees.
	Additional pre-approval is required for any increase in scope or in final fees.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Pursuant to these procedures, 100% of each of the services provided by the Company&#146;s external
	auditor relating to the fees reported as audit, audit-related, tax and all other fees were
	pre-approved by the Audit Committee or the Designated Member.
</DIV>
</EFX_ACCOUNTANT_FEES>
<EFX_OFF_BALANCE_SHEET_ARRANGEMENTS>
<A NAME="FIS_OFF_BALANCE_SHEET_ARRANGEMENTS"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	OFF-BALANCE SHEET ARRANGEMENTS
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	During the most recent fiscal year, the Company was not a party to any off-balance sheet
	arrangements that have or are reasonably likely to have a current or future material effect on its
	financial condition, revenues or expenses, results of operations, liquidity, capital expenditures
	or capital resources.
</DIV>
</EFX_OFF_BALANCE_SHEET_ARRANGEMENTS>
<EFX_DISCLOSURE_OF_OBLIGATIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_DISCLOSURE_OF_OBLIGATIONS"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	TABULAR DISCLOSURE OF CONTRACTUAL OBLIGATIONS
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	The information provided under the heading &#147;Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial
	Condition and Results of Operations &#150; Contractual Obligations,&#148; contained in Exhibit&nbsp;3 to this
	Annual Report on Form 40-F, is incorporated by reference herein.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	CORPORATE GOVERNANCE PRACTICES
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	Corporate Governance Practices Compared to NYSE and Nasdaq Listing Standards
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	The Company has reviewed its corporate governance practices against the requirements of the NYSE
	and Nasdaq, and determined that its corporate governance practices do not differ in any significant
	way from those followed by U.S. companies under NYSE and Nasdaq listing standards. This includes
	the composition of the board of directors, because in excess of one-half of the Company&#146;s directors
	(seven of twelve directors) are considered independent for purposes of the NYSE and Nasdaq
	corporate governance rules. The board of directors has determined the following seven directors to
	be independent under the NYSE and Nasdaq corporate governance rules: David Huberman, Markus Faber,
	Robert Hanson, Kjeld Thygesen, Howard Balloch, Livia Mahler and David Korbin. All of these
	directors are nominees for re-election to the Board at the 2010 annual general meeting scheduled
	for May&nbsp;7, 2010 (the &#147;Meeting&#148;). Shareholders of the Company will also be asked at the Meeting to
	approve a special resolution increasing the maximum number of directors of the Company from twelve
	(12)&nbsp;to fourteen (14), and to separately elect one additional director for the ensuing year,
	contingent upon the special resolution being passed. Such additional director is expected to
	qualify as an independent director under the NYSE and Nasdaq corporate governance rules effective
	June&nbsp;1, 2010. If the special resolution increasing the maximum number of directors of the Company
	is passed, the board of directors also intends to appoint, following the Meeting, one further board
	member to hold office until the next annual general meeting of the Company, which board member is
	also expected to be an independent director for purposes of the NYSE and Nasdaq corporate
	governance rules. Therefore following the Meeting, in excess of one-half of the Company&#146;s
	directors will continue to be considered independent for purposes of the NYSE and Nasdaq corporate
	governance rules.
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	7
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	Presiding Director at Meetings of Non-Management Directors
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	The Company&#146;s board of directors holds regular quarterly meetings and meets as required between the
	quarterly meetings. As part of the quarterly meetings, the Company&#146;s &#147;non-management directors&#148;
	(as that term is defined in the rules of the NYSE) have the opportunity to meet separate from
	management. If required, between regularly scheduled board meetings, a meeting of non-management
	directors is held by teleconference to update the directors on corporate developments since the
	last Board meeting. David Huberman, the Company&#146;s lead director (the &#147;Lead Director&#148;), serves as
	the presiding director at such meetings of non-management directors.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	Communication with Non-Management Directors
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Shareholders may send communications to the Company&#146;s non-management directors by writing to the
	Lead Director, c/o Ivanhoe Mines Ltd., 654 &#150; 999 Canada Place, Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
	V6C 3E1. Communications will be referred to the Lead Director for appropriate action. The status
	of all outstanding concerns addressed to the Lead Director will be reported to the board of
	directors as appropriate.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	Corporate Governance Guidelines
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	According to NYSE Rule&nbsp;303A.09 and Rule 4350(n) of the Nasdaq Listed Company Manual, a listed
	company must adopt and disclose a set of corporate governance guidelines with respect to specified
	topics. Such guidelines are required to be posted on the listed company&#146;s website. The Company
	has adopted the required guidelines and has posted them on its website at www.ivanhoemines.com.
	The required guidelines are available in print to any shareholder who requests them. Requests for
	copies of these documents should be made by contacting: Ivanhoe Mines Ltd., 654 &#150; 999 Canada Place,
	Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada V6C 3E1.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	Board Committee Mandates
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	The Mandates of the Company&#146;s Audit Committee, Compensation and Benefits Committee and Nominating
	and Corporate Governance Committee are each available for viewing on the Company&#146;s website at
	www.ivanhoemines.com, and are available in print to any shareholder who requests them. Requests
	for copies of these documents should be made by contacting: Ivanhoe Mines Ltd., 654 &#150; 999 Canada
	Place, Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada V6C 3E1.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	UNDERTAKING AND CONSENT TO SERVICE OF PROCESS
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	Undertaking
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	The Company undertakes to make available, in person or by telephone, representatives to respond to
	inquiries made by the Commission staff, and to furnish promptly, when requested to do so by the
	Commission staff, information relating to: the securities registered pursuant to Form 40-F; the
	securities in relation to which the obligation to file an annual report on Form 40-F arises; or
	transactions in said securities.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	Consent to Service of Process
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	The Company filed an Appointment of Agent for Service of Process and Undertaking on Form F-X on
	December&nbsp;17, 2003 with respect to the class of securities in relation to which the obligation to
	file the Form 40-F arises.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Any change to the name or address of the agent for service of process of the registrant shall be
	communicated promptly to the SEC by an amendment to the Form F-X referencing the file number of the
	Company.
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	8
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>

</EFX_DISCLOSURE_OF_OBLIGATIONS>

</A>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	INTERPRETATION INFORMATION
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="O59368EXV1_HTM_102">
</A>
</DIV>
<EFX_FORWARD_LOOK>
<A NAME="FIS_FORWARD_LOOK_2"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	Forward-Looking Information
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Certain statements made herein, including statements relating to matters that are not historical
	facts and statements of our beliefs, intentions and expectations about developments, results and
	events which will or may occur in the future, constitute &#147;forward-looking information&#148; within the
	meaning of applicable Canadian securities legislation and &#147;forward-looking statements&#148; within the
	meaning of the &#147;safe harbor&#148; provisions of the United States Private Securities Litigation Reform
	Act of 1995. Forward-looking information and statements are typically identified by words such as
	&#147;anticipate,&#148; &#147;could,&#148; &#147;should,&#148; &#147;expect,&#148; &#147;seek,&#148; &#147;may,&#148; &#147;intend,&#148; &#147;likely,&#148; &#147;plan,&#148; &#147;estimate,&#148;
	&#147;will&#148; &#147;believe&#148; and similar expressions suggesting future outcomes or statements regarding an
	outlook. These include, but are not limited to, statements respecting anticipated business
	activities; planned expenditures; corporate strategies; proposed acquisitions and dispositions of
	assets; discussions with third parties respecting material agreements; mining plans for the Oyu
	Tolgoi Project and the schedule for carrying out and completing construction of the Oyu Tolgoi
	Project; the estimated schedule and cost of bringing the Oyu Tolgoi Project into commercial
	production; anticipated future production and cash flows; target milling rates; mining plans and
	production forecasts for the Ovoot Tolgoi Coal Project; the schedule for carrying out and
	completing an expansion of the production capability of the Ovoot Tolgoi Coal Project; anticipated
	outcomes with respect to the ongoing marketing of coal products from the Ovoot Tolgoi Coal Project;
	the anticipated timing of payback of capital invested in the Ovoot Tolgoi Coal Project; the impact
	of amendments to the laws of Mongolia and other countries in which IVN carries on business,
	particularly with respect to taxation; the anticipated timing, cost and outcome of plans to
	continue the development of non-core projects, and other statements that are not historical facts.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	All such forward-looking information and statements are based on certain assumptions and analyses
	made by IVN&#146;s management in light of their experience and perception of historical trends, current
	conditions and expected future developments, as well as other factors management believes are
	appropriate in the circumstances. These statements, however, are subject to a variety of risks and
	uncertainties and other factors that could cause actual events or results to differ materially from
	those projected in the forward-looking information or statements. Important factors that could
	cause actual results to differ from these forward-looking statements include those described under
	the heading &#147;GENERAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE BUSINESS &#150; Risk Factors&#148; in this AIF. The reader is
	cautioned not to place undue reliance on forward-looking information or statements.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	This AIF also contains references to estimates of mineral reserves and mineral resources. The
	estimation of reserves and resources is inherently uncertain and involves subjective judgments
	about many relevant factors. The accuracy of any such estimates is a function of the quantity and
	quality of available data, and of the assumptions made and judgments used in engineering and
	geological interpretation, which may prove to be unreliable. There can be no assurance that these
	estimates will be accurate or that such mineral reserves and mineral resources can be mined or
	processed profitably. Mineral resources that are not mineral reserves do not have demonstrated
	economic viability.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	IVN does not assume any obligation, other than as required by law, to revise or update any
	forward-looking statements in this AIF after the date of this AIF or to revise them to reflect the
	occurrence of future unanticipated events.
</DIV>

	references to &#147;Aus$&#148; are to Australian dollars

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	Definitions
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In this AIF, unless the context otherwise requires, the following terms have the meanings assigned
	to them below. Certain other scientific and technical terms and abbreviations used in this AIF are
	defined under the section headed &#147;Technical Terms and Abbreviations&#148;.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&#147;
<B>
	AIF
</B>
	&#148; means this Annual Information Form.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&#147;
<B>
	Altynalmas Gold
</B>
	&#148; means Altynalmas Gold Ltd.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&#147;
<B>
	AMEC Minproc
</B>
	&#148; means AMEC Minproc Limited (formerly GRD Minproc Limited).
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&#147;
<B>
	Anti-Dilution Warrants
</B>
	&#148; means share purchase warrants exercisable to acquire Common Shares issued
	to Rio Tinto pursuant to Rio Tinto&#146;s exercise of its pre-emptive rights under the Private Placement
	Agreement.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&#147;
<B>
	Approved Investment Contract
</B>
	&#148; means an Investment Contract that is approved by the Company&#146;s board
	of directors and that is mutually acceptable to the Company and Rio Tinto, acting reasonably.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&#147;
<B>
	ASX
</B>
	&#148; means the Australian Stock Exchange.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&#147;
<B>
	Cloncurry Project
</B>
	&#148; means Ivanhoe Australia&#146;s molybdenum, rhenium, copper, gold and uranium
	exploration and development project located in Queensland, Australia.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&#147;
<B>
	Common Shares
</B>
	&#148; means common shares without par value in the capital of the Company.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&#147;
<B>
	Contract Assignment Arrangement Agreement
</B>
	&#148; means an agreement dated as of August&nbsp;13, 2008 among
	the Company, OT LLC and Rio Tinto Alcan.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&#147;

	Credit Agreement
</B>
	&#148; means the credit agreement dated as of October&nbsp;24, 2007, as amended, between the
	Company, as borrower, and Rio Tinto, as lender.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&#147;
<B>
	Entr&#233;e
</B>
	&#148; means Entr&#233;e Gold Inc.

</B>
	&#148; means the joint venture between IVN and Entr&#233;e contemplated by the Entr&#233;e
	Earn-in Agreement in respect of a portion of the Hugo North Extension in which (i)&nbsp;IVN holds an 80%
	interest and Entr&#233;e holds a 20% interest in minerals below 560m and (ii)&nbsp;IVN holds a 70% interest
	and Entr&#233;e holds a 30% interest in minerals above 560m.

	be amended from time to time, among the Government of Mongolia, OT LLC, IVN and Rio Tinto in
	respect of the Oyu Tolgoi Project, providing legal, administrative and tax stability during its
	term and extension, if any, and guaranteeing that the legal, administrative and tax framework in
	force in Mongolia when the agreement is entered into will remain unmodified during its term and
	extension, if any, notwithstanding any modification, either introduced by law or regulations,
	enacted after the execution of the agreement, and includes any agreement superseding or replacing
	the investment agreement dated October&nbsp;6, 2009.
</DIV>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	1.609 km
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	1 mile
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:-0PX">
	0.032 ounces (troy)
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	1 gram
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	31.1 grams
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	1 ounce (troy)
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:-0PX">
	2.205 pounds
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	1 kilogram
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	0.454 kilograms
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	1 pound
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:-0PX">
	1.102 tons (short)
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	1 tonne
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	0.907 tonnes
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	1 ton
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">

	0.029 ounces (troy)/ton
</DIV>

	1 gram/tonne
</TD>

	&nbsp;

</TD>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="O59368EXV1_HTM_106">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	Glossary of Technical Terms and Abbreviations
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Certain scientific and technical terms and abbreviations used in this AIF are defined below.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	anomaly:
</B>
	a departure from the norm which may indicate the presence of mineralization in the
	underlying bedrock.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	assay:
</B>
	the chemical analysis of an ore, mineral or concentrate of metal to determine the amount of
	valuable species.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	Au:
</B>
	gold.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	chalcocite:
</B>
	a form of copper mineral ore that generally contains a high copper content.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	chalcopyrite:
</B>
	a form of copper mineral ore that generally contains a low copper content.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	CIM
</B>
	: the Canadian Institute of Mining, Metallurgy and Petroleum.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	CIM Standards
</B>
	: CIM Definition Standards on Mineral Resources and Mineral Reserves adopted by the
	CIM Council on December&nbsp;11, 2005, as those definitions may be amended from time to time.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	concentrate:
</B>
	a product containing valuable metal from which most of the waste material in the ore
	has been eliminated.
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	- 5 -
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage19"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
<A HREF="#O59368EXV1_HTM_TOCPAGE">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	concentrator:
</B>
	a plant for recovery of valuable minerals from ore in the form of concentrate. The
	concentrate must then be treated in some other type of plant, such as a smelter, to effect recovery
	of the pure metal.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	covellite:
</B>
	a supergene mineral found in copper deposits; a source of copper.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	Cu
</B>
	: copper.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	CuEq
</B>
	: a copper equivalent grade, calculated using assumed metal prices for copper, gold and, where
	applicable, molybdenum.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	cut-off grade:
</B>
	the lowest grade of mineral resources considered economic; used in the calculation
	of reserves and resources in a given deposit.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	dyke:
</B>
	a tabular igneous intrusion that cuts across the bedding or foliation of the country rock.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	fault:
</B>
	a fracture in rock along which the adjacent rock surfaces are differentially displaced.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	feasibility study:
</B>
	a comprehensive study of a mineral deposit in which all geological, engineering,
	legal, operating, economic, social, environmental and other relevant factors are considered in
	sufficient detail that it could reasonably serve as the basis for a final decision by a financial
	institution to finance the development of the deposit for mineral production.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	flotation:
</B>
	a milling process by which some mineral particles are induced to become attached to
	bubbles of froth and float, and others to sink, so that the valuable minerals are concentrated and
	separated from the gangue.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	gangue:
</B>
	valueless rock or mineral material in ore.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	g/t
</B>
	: grams per tonne.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	GSC Paper 88 &#150; 21
</B>
	: the Geological Survey of Canada Paper 88-21 &#147;A Standardized Coal
	Resource/Reserve Reporting System for Canada&#148;, which is a reference for qualified persons
	estimating NI 43-101 compliant mineral resources or mineral reserves for coal, provided the
	estimates are disclosed using the categories set out in the CIM Standards.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	hypogene:
</B>
	primary mineralization formed by mineralizing solutions emanating up from a deep magnetic
	source.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	HQ:
</B>
	diamond drilling equipment that produces a 63.5 millimetre core diameter.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	indicated mineral resource:
</B>
	that part of a mineral resource for which quantity, grade or quality,
	densities, shape and physical characteristics can be estimated with a level of confidence
	sufficient to allow the appropriate application of technical and economic parameters to support
	mine planning and evaluation of the economic viability of the deposit. The estimate is based on
	detailed and reliable exploration and test information gathered through appropriate techniques from
	locations such as outcrops, trenches, pits, workings and drill holes that are spaced closely enough
	for geological and grade continuity to be reasonably assumed.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	inferred mineral resource:
</B>
	that part of a mineral resource for which the quantity and grade or
	quality can be estimated on the basis of geological evidence and limited sampling and reasonably
	assumed, but not verified, geological and grade continuity. The estimate is based on limited
	information and sampling gathered through appropriate techniques from locations such as outcrops,
	trenches, pits, workings and drill holes.
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	- 6 -
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage20"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
<A HREF="#O59368EXV1_HTM_TOCPAGE">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	intrusive:
</B>
	rock which while molten, penetrated into or between other rocks but solidified before
	reaching the surface.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	IP:
</B>
	induced polarization.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	km
</B>
	: kilometres.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	km
</B>
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
<B>
	2
</B>
</SUP>
	: square kilometres.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	kriging:
</B>
	A weighted, moving-average interpolation method in which the set of weights assigned to
	samples minimizes the estimation variance, which is computed as a function of the variogram model
	and locations of the samples relative to each other, and to the point or block being estimated.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	lb
</B>
	: pound.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	leach:
</B>
	to dissolve minerals or metals out of ore with chemicals.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	m
</B>
	: metres.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	mm
</B>
	: millimetres.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	measured mineral resource:
</B>
	that part of a mineral resource for which quantity, grade or quality,
	densities, shape and physical characteristics are so well established that they can be estimated
	with confidence sufficient to allow the appropriate application of technical and economic
	parameters to support production planning and evaluation of the economic viability of the deposit.
	The estimate is based on detailed and reliable exploration, sampling and testing information
	gathered through appropriate techniques from locations such as outcrops, trenches, pits, workings
	and drill holes that are spaced closely enough to confirm both geological and grade continuity.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	metallurgic coal:
</B>
	various grades of coal suitable for making steel, such as coking coal.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	mineral reserve:
</B>
	the economically mineable part of a measured or indicated mineral resource
	demonstrated by at least a preliminary feasibility study. This study must include adequate
	information on mining, processing, metallurgical, and economic and other relevant factors that
	demonstrate, at the time of reporting, that economic extraction can be justified. An ore reserve
	includes diluting materials and allowances for losses that may occur when the material is mined.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	mineral resource (deposit):
</B>
	a concentration or occurrence of natural, solid, inorganic or
	fossilized organic material in or on the earth&#146;s crust in such form and quantity and of such a
	grade or quality that it has reasonable prospects for economic extraction. The location, quantity,
	grade, geological characteristics and continuity of a mineral resource (deposit)&nbsp;are known,
	estimated or interpreted from specific geological evidence and knowledge.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	Mo
</B>
	: molybdenum.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	NI 43-101
</B>
	: National Instrument 43-101 of the Canadian Securities Administrators.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	NQ:
</B>
	diamond drilling equipment that produces a 47.5 millimetre core diameter.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	oz
</B>
	: ounce.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	porphyry:
</B>
	any igneous rock in which relatively large, conspicuous crystals (called phenocrysts) are
	set in a fine-grained ground mass.
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	- 7 -
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage21"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
<A HREF="#O59368EXV1_HTM_TOCPAGE">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	ppm
</B>
	: parts per million.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	preliminary assessment
</B>
	: a study that includes an economic analysis of the potential viability of
	mineral resources taken at an early stage of the project prior to the completion of a preliminary
	feasibility study.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	preliminary feasibility study
</B>
	and
<B>
	pre-feasibility study
</B>
	: a comprehensive study of the viability of
	a mineral project that has advanced to a stage where the mining method, in the case of underground
	mining, or the pit configuration, in the case of an open pit, has been established and an effective
	method of mineral processing has been determined, and includes a financial analysis based on
	reasonable assumptions of technical, engineering, legal, operating, economic, social, and
	environmental factors and the evaluation of other relevant factors which are sufficient for a
	qualified person, acting reasonably, to determine if all or part of the mineral resource may be
	classified as a mineral reserve.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	probable reserve:
</B>
	the economically mineable part of an indicated and, in some circumstances, a
	measured mineral resource demonstrated by at least a preliminary feasibility study. This study
	must include adequate information on mining, processing, metallurgical, economic and other relevant
	factors that demonstrate, at the time of reporting, that economic extraction can be justified.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	proven reserve:
</B>
	the economically mineable part of a measured mineral resource demonstrated by at
	least a preliminary feasibility study. This study must include adequate information on mining,
	processing, metallurgical, economic and other relevant factors that demonstrate, at the time of
	reporting, that economic extraction can be justified.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	PQ:
</B>
	diamond drilling equipment that produces an 85 millimetre core diameter.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	qualified person:
</B>
	an individual who: (a)&nbsp;is an engineer or geoscientist with at least five years
	of experience in mineral exploration, mine development or operation, or mineral project assessment,
	or any combination of these; (b)&nbsp;has experience relevant to the subject matter of the mineral
	project; and (c)&nbsp;is a member in good standing of a professional association as defined by NI
	43-101.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	QMD or quartz monzodiorite:
</B>
	plutonic rock containing quartz, alkali feldspars, plagioclase
	feldspars and feldspathoid minerals.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	RC:
</B>
	reverse circulation.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	seam:
</B>
	A stratum or bed of coal or other mineral; generally applied to large deposits of coal.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	splits:
</B>
	The division of a bed of coal into two or more horizontal sections by intervening rock
	strata.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	stock:
</B>
	an irregular, metalliferous mass in a rock formation.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	strike:
</B>
	the direction, or course or bearing, of a vein or rock formation measured on a level
	surface.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	sulphides:
</B>
	compounds of sulphur with other metallic elements.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	supergene:
</B>
	ore minerals that have been formed by the effects (usually oxidization and secondary
	sulphide enrichment) of descending ground water.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	thermal coal
</B>
	: coal that is used primarily for its heating value and that tends not to have the
	carbonization properties possessed by metallurgic coal.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	tpd
</B>
	: tonnes per day.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<B>
	tpy
</B>
	: tonnes per year.
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	- 8 -
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage22"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
<A HREF="#O59368EXV1_HTM_TOCPAGE">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
</EFX_FORWARD_LOOK>
<P>
<EFX_CORPORATE_STRUCTURE>
<A NAME="FIS_CORPORATE_STRUCTURE"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="O59368EXV1_HTM_107">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	CORPORATE STRUCTURE
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="O59368EXV1_HTM_108">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	Name, Address and Incorporation
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	The Company was incorporated under the
<I>
	Company Act
</I>
	(British Columbia) on January&nbsp;25, 1994 under the
	name 463212 B.C. Ltd. In February&nbsp;1994, the Company changed its name to Indochina Goldfields Ltd.
	In March&nbsp;1994, the Company increased its authorized capital from 10,000 Common Shares to
	100,000,000 Common Shares and created 100,000,000 Preferred Shares. In February&nbsp;1995, the Company
	was continued under the YBCA. In July&nbsp;1997, the Company increased its authorized capital to an
	unlimited number of Common Shares and an unlimited number of Preferred Shares. In June&nbsp;1999, the
	Company changed its name to Ivanhoe Mines Ltd.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	The Company&#146;s head office is located at 654 &#151; 999 Canada Place, Vancouver, British Columbia,
	Canada, V6C 3E1 and its Asian headquarters are located at 150 Beach Road, #25-03 The Gateway West,
	Singapore, 189720. The Company&#146;s registered office is located at 300 &#151; 204 Black Street,
	Whitehorse, Yukon, Canada, Y1A 2M9.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="O59368EXV1_HTM_109">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	Intercorporate Relationships
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	The following sets forth the name, jurisdiction of incorporation and the IVN Group&#146;s voting equity
	ownership interest, as of the date of this AIF, in each of the material subsidiaries through which
	the Company ultimately owns its assets and operates its business. These subsidiaries are grouped
	according to the particular IVN Group project or asset to which they relate and are presented in
	descending order according to the chain of voting equity ownership. Accordingly, the first such
	subsidiary presented in each group is owned directly by the Company and the voting equity ownership
	interest of the Company in that subsidiary is shown in the right hand column opposite its name and
	jurisdiction of incorporation. The voting equity ownership interest shown in respect of each other
	subsidiary is, except as otherwise indicated, that of the subsidiary listed immediately above it.
	In the case of the Oyu Tolgoi Project, the IVN Group&#146;s voting equity ownership interest
	therein is divided between two parallel groups of subsidiaries.
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_6"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<U>
<B>
	Oyu Tolgoi Project Group One Subsidiaries
</B>
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT" CELLSPACING="0" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<!-- BEGIN TABLE HEAD -->
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="60%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Additional direct and indirect subsidiaries of the Company (i)&nbsp;holding, individually, 10% or
	less and, in the aggregate, 20% or less of the IVN Group&#146;s consolidated assets, and (ii)
	generating, individually, 10% or less and, in the aggregate, 20% or less of the IVN Group&#146;s
	consolidated sales and operating revenues, in each case, as at December&nbsp;31, 2009 have been omitted.
</DIV>
</EFX_CORPORATE_STRUCTURE>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="O59368EXV1_HTM_110">
</A>
</DIV>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	GENERAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE BUSINESS
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="O59368EXV1_HTM_111">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	Overview
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	IVN is an international mineral exploration and development company. The Company&#146;s principal
	mineral resource property is the Oyu Tolgoi Project, located in Mongolia. The Company also has two
	publicly traded subsidiaries through which it holds interests in coal resource properties in
	Mongolia and molybdenum, rhenium, copper, gold and uranium resource properties in Australia.
	SouthGobi, the shares of which are listed on the TSX and the HKSE, owns and operates the Ovoot
	Tolgoi Coal Project located in Mongolia. Ivanhoe Australia, the shares of which are listed on the
	ASX, owns the Cloncurry Project located in Queensland, Australia. The IVN Group also holds
	interests in several other mineral resource projects in Asia, including a 50% interest in the Kyzyl
	Shear Project, located in Kazakhstan, through a shareholding in Altynalmas Gold.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="O59368EXV1_HTM_112">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	Three Year History
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
	2007
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In May&nbsp;2007, IVN re-organized its coal assets and sold them to SouthGobi (then Asia Gold Corp.), a
	company in which IVN held approximately 45% of the issued and outstanding shares. These assets
	included the Ovoot Tolgoi Coal Project and other prospective coal properties in Mongolia. As
	consideration for IVN&#146;s coal assets, SouthGobi issued 57,000,000 common shares and 25,576,383
	preferred shares (each convertible into a SouthGobi common share) to IVN. As a result of the
	transaction, SouthGobi became a majority-owned, publicly traded IVN subsidiary.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In October&nbsp;2007, IVN and Rio Tinto entered into the Credit Agreement, pursuant to which IVN
	obtained a convertible credit facility of up to $350&nbsp;million to finance ongoing development
	activities at the Oyu Tolgoi Project. In connection with the completion of the Credit Agreement,
	IVN and Rio Tinto also agreed to amend
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	- 10 -
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage24"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
<A HREF="#O59368EXV1_HTM_TOCPAGE">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	certain terms of the Private Placement Agreement. See
	&#147;GENERAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE BUSINESS &#150; Rio Tinto Transactions &#150; Credit Agreement&#148;.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
	2008
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In January&nbsp;2008, SouthGobi completed three equity private placement financings to raise a total of
	Cdn$117.9&nbsp;million. The first private placement involved the issuance of 10&nbsp;million common shares
	at Cdn$8.00 per share. The second and third private placements involved the issuance of 3.5&nbsp;million
	common shares and 711,111 common shares, respectively, each at Cdn$9.00 per share. Concurrent with
	these financings, IVN converted all of its SouthGobi preferred shares into 25,576,383 SouthGobi
	common shares and approximately Cdn$30&nbsp;million of convertible inter-corporate debt into 14,709,071
	additional SouthGobi common shares.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In January&nbsp;2008, IVN announced that it had completed an estimate of inferred resources at the
	Heruga Deposit, a newly discovered deposit of the Oyu Tolgoi Project located on lands covered by
	the Entr&#233;e Joint Venture. IVN reported inferred resources of 760&nbsp;million tonnes grading 0.48%
	copper, 0.55g/t gold and 142 ppm molybdenum, using a 0.60% copper equivalent cut-off grade.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In April&nbsp;2008, SouthGobi received government approval to mine coal at the Ovoot Tolgoi Coal Project
	and subsequently commenced mining and stockpiling coal from the Sunset Field.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In May&nbsp;2008, IVN completed the sale of its controlling stake in Jinshan Gold Mines Inc. (&#147;Jinshan&#148;)
	to China National Gold Group Hong Kong Ltd. (&#147;China National&#148;). China National purchased IVN&#146;s
	entire holding of 67,520,000 common shares of Jinshan at a price of Cdn$3.11per share and a Jinshan
	promissory note in the principal amount of Cdn$7,500,000, for an aggregate purchase price of
	approximately Cdn$216.7&nbsp;million.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In June&nbsp;2008, IVN notified Entr&#233;e that it had completed $35&nbsp;million in expenditures on the property
	covered by the Entr&#233;e Joint Venture, and had thereby earned an 80% interest in minerals below 560 m
	and a 70% interest on minerals above that depth.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In August&nbsp;2008, Ivanhoe Australia completed a Aus$125&nbsp;million initial public offering. Ivanhoe
	Australia sold 62.5&nbsp;million shares at a price of Aus$2 per share and began trading on ASX under the
	symbol &#147;IVA&#148;. The offering raised capital for the ongoing exploration and development of the
	Cloncurry Project.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In August&nbsp;2008, the Company, OT LLC and Rio Tinto Alcan entered into the Contract Assignment
	Arrangement Agreement, which provided for Rio Tinto Alcan to purchase from OT LLC certain Oyu
	Tolgoi Project equipment already acquired by OT LLC, and to take an assignment of certain contracts
	with third party suppliers for additional Oyu Tolgoi Project equipment on long lead time order,
	pending the successful completion of negotiations with the Government of Mongolia for an Investment
	Agreement. The Company, OT LLC and Rio Tinto Alcan also entered into the Put Agreement whereby Rio
	Tinto Alcan had the right to require OT LLC to re-purchase the equipment upon OT LLC entering into
	an Investment Agreement. See &#147;GENERAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE BUSINESS &#150; Rio Tinto Transactions &#150;
	Contract Assignment Arrangement Agreement and Put Agreement&#148;.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
	2009
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In October&nbsp;2009, the Company, OT LLC, Rio Tinto and the Government of Mongolia entered into an
	Investment Agreement in respect of the OT Project. The Investment Agreement provides for, among
	other things, a framework for maintaining a stable tax and operational environment for the Oyu
	Tolgoi Project, protection of the parties&#146; investment in the Oyu Tolgoi Project, the amount and
	term of the parties&#146; investment
	in the Oyu Tolgoi Project, the right to realize the benefits of such investment, the undertaking of
	mining activities with minimum damage to the environment and human health, the rehabilitation of
	the environment, the social and economic development of the Southern Gobi region and the creation
	of new jobs in Mongolia.
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	- 11 -
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage25"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
<A HREF="#O59368EXV1_HTM_TOCPAGE">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	See &#147;GENERAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE BUSINESS &#150; Agreements with the Government
	of Mongolia &#150; Investment Agreement&#148;.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Concurrent with the execution of the Investment Agreement, OT LLC and two indirect, wholly-owned
	subsidiaries of the Company through which the Company holds its interest in OT LLC entered into the
	Shareholders&#146; Agreement with Erdenes. The Shareholders&#146; Agreement contemplates the basis upon which
	the Government of Mongolia will, through Erdenes, acquire an initial 34% equity interest in the Oyu
	Tolgoi Project through a shareholding in OT LLC and provides for the respective rights and
	obligations of the parties as shareholders of OT LLC. See &#147;GENERAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE BUSINESS &#150;
	Agreements with the Government of Mongolia &#150; Shareholders&#146; Agreement&#148;.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Concurrent with the execution of the Investment Agreement, OT LLC also entered into the T-Bill
	Purchase Agreement with the Government of Mongolia pursuant to which OT LLC agreed to purchase from
	the Government, in instalments, three discounted Treasury Bills with an aggregate face value of
	US$287.5&nbsp;million for an aggregate purchase price of US$250&nbsp;million. See &#147;GENERAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE
	BUSINESS &#150; Agreements with the Government of Mongolia &#150; T-Bill Purchase Agreement&#148;.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In October&nbsp;2009, Rio Tinto completed the Second Tranche Investment under the Private Placement
	Agreement. Pursuant to the Second Tranche Investment, the Company issued, and Rio Tinto subscribed
	for and purchased, 46,304,473 Common Shares at $8.38 per share for gross proceeds of $388&nbsp;million.
	See &#147;GENERAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE BUSINESS &#150; Rio Tinto Transactions &#150; Private Placement Agreement&#148;.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In November&nbsp;2009, SouthGobi and China Investment Corporation entered into a series of agreements
	providing for a US$500&nbsp;million convertible debenture investment in SouthGobi by China Investment
	Corporation. The convertible debenture has a term of 30&nbsp;years and bears interest at 8% per annum,
	of which 1.6% is payable in common shares. The principal amount is convertible at Cdn$11.88 per
	share, or a lower amount if the prevailing stock price of SouthGobi is less than such amount, to a
	floor price of Cdn$8.88 per share. Conversion is at the option of China Investment Corporation on
	or after November, 2010. SouthGobi is entitled to require conversion of one-half of the principal
	amount at any time upon completion of an HKSE listing (which occurred in January&nbsp;2010) and to
	require conversion of the entire amount as of and after November&nbsp;2014. China Investment Corporation
	holds a security interest in SouthGobi&#146;s assets, has a pre-emptive right on future SouthGobi share
	issuances and is entitled to nominate a director for election or appointment to SouthGobi&#146;s board
	of directors.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
	2010 to date
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In January&nbsp;2010, SouthGobi issued 27&nbsp;million common shares at a price of Cdn$17.00 per share for
	gross proceeds of Cdn$459&nbsp;million pursuant to a public offering in Hong Kong, Canada and other
	jurisdictions, which was accompanied by a listing of SouthGobi&#146;s common shares on the HKSE.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In February&nbsp;2010, Rio Tinto Alcan notified OT LLC that it was exercising its option under the Put
	Agreement to require OT LLC to re-purchase the Oyu Tolgoi Project equipment Rio Tinto acquired from
	OT LLC in 2008 pursuant to the Contract Arrangement Assignment Agreement.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In March&nbsp;2010, IVN and Rio Tinto completed a private placement pursuant to which Rio Tinto
	subscribed for the Put Option Placement Shares. See &#147;GENERAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE BUSINESS &#150; Rio
	Tinto Transactions &#150; Contract Assignment Arrangement Agreement and Put Agreement&#148;.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In March, 2010, at SouthGobi&#146;s request, China Investment Corporation converted US$250&nbsp;million of
	the convertible debenture into common shares of SouthGobi at a conversion price of Cdn$11.88 per
	share. As a result of the conversion, IVN&#146;s interest in SouthGobi was reduced to approximately 57%.
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	- 12 -
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>

<P>
<A NAME="eolPage26"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
<A HREF="#O59368EXV1_HTM_TOCPAGE">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In March&nbsp;2010, the remaining conditions to the effectiveness of the Investment Agreement were
	fulfilled and the terms of the Investment Agreement became effective. For the balance of 2010, IVN
	anticipates continuing its Oyu Tolgoi Project development work and plans to finalize an updated
	integrated development plan for the Oyu Tolgoi Project based on the terms of the approved
	Investment Agreement.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="O59368EXV1_HTM_113">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<B>
	Rio Tinto Transactions
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In 2006, Ivanhoe identified Rio Tinto as a strategic investor to support development of the Oyu
	Tolgoi Project. The parties have entered into a series of agreements since 2006 pursuant to which
	Rio Tinto has provided equity and debt financing to fund ongoing development of the Oyu Tolgoi
	Project and company operations. As a result of these transactions, Rio Tinto holds a significant
	investment interest in IVN and is actively involved in the development process of the Oyu Tolgoi
	Project.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
	Private Placement Agreement
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In October&nbsp;2006, the Company and Rio Tinto entered into the Private Placement Agreement and the
	First Tranche Investment was completed, pursuant to which the Company issued 37,089,883 Common
	Shares to Rio Tinto at a price of $8.18 per share, for an aggregate subscription price of
	$303,395,243. The First Tranche Investment represented, upon issuance, 9.95% of the then issued and
	outstanding Common Shares.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In October&nbsp;2009, the Second Tranche Investment was completed, pursuant to which the Company issued
	a further 46,304,473 Common Shares to Rio Tinto at a price of $8.38 for an aggregate subscription
	price of US$388,031,484. The combined First Tranche Investment and Second Tranche Investment
	represented, upon issuance, 19.7% of the then issued and outstanding Common Shares.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	In conjunction with the First Tranche Investment, the Company issued to Rio Tinto the Series&nbsp;A
	Warrants and the Series&nbsp;B Warrants. The Series&nbsp;A Warrants entitle Rio Tinto to purchase up to
	46,026,522 Common Shares at prices per Common Share ranging from US$8.38 to US$8.54 depending on
	when they are exercised. The Series&nbsp;A Warrants expire 365&nbsp;days after the Warrant Determination
	Date. The Series&nbsp;B Warrants entitle Rio Tinto to purchase up to 46,026,522 Common Shares at prices
	per Common Share ranging from US$8.38 to US$9.02 depending on when they are exercised. The Series&nbsp;B
	Warrants expire 725&nbsp;days after the Warrant Determination Date.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Rio Tinto has been granted pre-emptive rights entitling Rio Tinto to participate, subject to
	certain specific exceptions, in future issuances of Common Shares on a basis sufficient to maintain
	its percentage shareholding interest in the Company on economic terms equivalent to those upon
	which any such Common Shares are issued to third parties.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	The Company has agreed that it will use not less than ninety per cent (90%) of the proceeds from
	all Common Shares issued to Rio Tinto under the terms of the Private Placement Agreement, including
	the First Tranche Investment, the Second Tranche Investment and the exercise, if any, of the Series
	A Warrants and the Series&nbsp;B Warrants, on expenditures in furtherance of the Oyu Tolgoi Project.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	Rio Tinto has agreed that, until October&nbsp;18, 2011, the Rio Tinto Group will not, without the prior
	consent of the Company:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
<TD WIDTH="3%" STYLE="BACKGROUND: TRANSPARENT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	make a take-over bid or a tender offer for, or otherwise acquire any Common Shares or
	securities convertible into Common Shares or engage in certain other specified activities
	except as contemplated by the Private Placement Agreement;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<!-- FOLIO -->
	- 13 -
<!-- /FOLIO -->
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage27"></A>

</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN',TIMES,SERIF">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">

	prior to having fully exercised all of the Series&nbsp;A Warrants and Series&nbsp;B Warrants,
	directly or indirectly acquire, alone or jointly or in concert with any other person, any
	Common Shares or securities convertible into Common Shares (other than Common Shares or
	securities acquired through an issuance by the Company) representing more than 6.65% of the
	then issued and outstanding Common Shares, provided that the Put Option Placement Shares
	will be counted toward such 6.65% threshold; or
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
