<A NAME="eolPage117"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Notes to
	the Consolidated Financial Statements
<BR>
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	(Stated
	in U.S. dollars unless otherwise noted; tabular amounts in
	thousands)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="97%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	2.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	SIGNIFICANT
	ACCOUNTING POLICIES (Continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	(r)&#160;&#160;Accounting
	changes (Continued)
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	nonauthoritative. The adoption of the ASC had no impact on the
	Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of
	operations or cash flows.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	In December 2007, the ASC guidance for noncontrolling interests
	was updated to establish accounting and reporting standards
	pertaining to (i)&#160;the nature and classification of the
	noncontrolling interest in the Consolidated Statement of
	Financial Position, (ii)&#160;attributing net income and
	comprehensive income to the parent and the noncontrolling
	interest, (iii)&#160;changes in a parent&#146;s ownership
	interest in a subsidiary, and (iv)&#160;deconsolidation of a
	subsidiary. For presentation and disclosure purposes, the
	updated guidance requires noncontrolling interests to be
	classified as a separate component of shareholders&#146; equity.
	The Company adopted the provisions of the updated guidance on
	January&#160;1, 2009. Except for presentation changes, the
	adoption of the updated guidance had no impact on the
	Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of
	operations or cash flows.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	In December 2007, the ASC guidance for business combinations was
	updated. The updated guidance changes accounting for
	acquisitions that close beginning in 2009. More transactions and
	events will qualify as business combinations and will be
	accounted for at fair value under the new standard. The updated
	guidance promotes greater use of fair values in financial
	reporting. Some of the changes will introduce more volatility
	into earnings. The updated guidance was effective for the
	Company&#146;s fiscal year beginning on January&#160;1, 2009.
	The adoption of the updated guidance had no impact on the
	Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of
	operations or cash flows.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	In May 2008, the ASC guidance for convertible debt instruments
	was updated. The updated guidance applies to convertible debt
	instruments that, by their stated terms, may be settled in cash
	(or other assets) upon conversion, including partial cash
	settlement, unless the embedded conversion option is required to
	be separately accounted for as a derivative. The updated
	guidance requires that the liability and equity components of
	convertible debt instruments within its scope be separately
	accounted for in a manner that reflects the entity&#146;s
	nonconvertible borrowing rate. This requires an allocation of
	the convertible debt proceeds between the liability component
	and the embedded conversion option (i.e., the equity component).
	The difference between the principal amount of the debt and the
	amount of the proceeds allocated to the liability component will
	be reported as a debt discount and subsequently amortized to
	earnings over the instrument&#146;s expected life using the
	effective interest method. The updated guidance was effective
	for the Company&#146;s fiscal year beginning on January&#160;1,
	2009 and has been applied retrospectively to all periods
	presented. The adoption of the updated guidance had no impact on
	the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of
	operations or cash flows.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	In October 2008, the ASC guidance for an instrument (or embedded
	feature) with a settlement amount that is based on the stock of
	an entity&#146;s consolidated subsidiary was updated to clarify
	whether such an instrument (or embedded feature) qualifies for
	the scope exemption from derivative accounting. For purposes of
	applying the scope exemption from derivative accounting,
	freestanding financial instruments (and embedded features) for
	which the payoff to the counterparty is based, in whole or in
	part, on the stock of a consolidated subsidiary are not
	precluded from being considered indexed to the entity&#146;s own
	stock in the consolidated financial statements of the parent. An
	equity-classified instrument (including an embedded feature that
	is separately recorded in equity under applicable GAAP) within
	the scope of the updated guidance shall be presented as a
	component of noncontrolling interest in the consolidated
	financial statements whether the instrument was entered into by
	the parent or the subsidiary. The updated guidance was effective
	for the Company&#146;s fiscal year beginning on January&#160;1,
	2009 and has been applied prospectively. The adoption of the
	updated guidance resulted in the reclassification of the fair
	value of the derivative
</TD>
</TR>
<!-- XBRL PARAGRAPH PAGEBREAK -->
</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	11
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">

	(r)&#160;&#160;Accounting
	changes (Continued)

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">

</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	contract to noncontrolling interests on January&#160;1, 2009 and
	any subsequent changes to the fair value of the derivative
	contract will no longer be recorded through earnings.
</TD>

</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	In November 2008, the ASC guidance for equity method investment
	accounting was updated. The updated guidance clarifies the
	accounting for certain transactions and impairment
	considerations involving equity method investments. The updated
	guidance provides guidance on a number of factors, including,
	determination of the initial carrying value of an equity method
	investment, performing an impairment assessment of an underlying
	indefinite-lived intangible asset of an equity method
	investment, accounting for an equity method investee&#146;s
	issuance of shares, and accounting for a change in an investment
	from the equity method to the cost method. The updated guidance
	was effective for the Company&#146;s fiscal year beginning on
	January&#160;1, 2009 and has been applied prospectively. The
	adoption of the updated guidance had no impact on the
	Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of
	operations or cash flows.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	In April 2009, the ASC guidance was updated to provide
	additional guidance on determining fair value when the volume
	and level of activity for an asset or liability have
	significantly decreased and includes guidance on identifying
	circumstances that indicate when a transaction is not orderly.
	The updated guidance is effective for interim and annual
	reporting periods ending on or after June&#160;15, 2009, and
	shall be applied prospectively. The Company adopted the
	provisions of the updated guidance for the year ended
	December&#160;31, 2009. The adoption of the updated guidance had
	no impact on the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position,
	results of operations or cash flows.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	In April 2009, the ASC guidance for interim disclosures about
	fair value was updated to require disclosures about the fair
	value of financial instruments for interim reporting periods of
	publicly traded companies as well as in annual financial
	statements. The updated guidance is effective for interim and
	annual reporting periods ending on or after June&#160;15, 2009.
	The Company adopted the provisions of the updated guidance for
	the year ended December&#160;31, 2009. The adoption of the
	updated guidance had no impact on the Company&#146;s
	consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash
	flows.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	In May 2009, the ASC guidance for subsequent events was updated.
	The updated guidance establishes accounting and reporting
	standards for events that occur after the balance sheet date but
	before financial statements are issued or are available to be
	issued. The updated guidance sets forth (i)&#160;the period
	after the balance sheet date during which management of a
	reporting entity should evaluate events or transactions that may
	occur for potential recognition or disclosure in the financial
	statements, (ii)&#160;the circumstances under which an entity
	should recognize events or transactions occurring after the
	balance sheet in its financial statements, and (iii)&#160;the
	disclosures that an entity should make about events or
	transactions occurring after the balance sheet date in its
	financial statements. The Company adopted the provisions of the
	updated guidance for the year ended December&#160;31, 2009. The
	adoption of the updated guidance had no impact on the
	Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of
	operations or cash flows.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,N -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="97%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	3.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	EXPLORATION
	EXPENSES
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,BODY -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Generally, exploration costs are charged to operations in the
	period incurred until such time as it has been determined that a
	property has economically recoverable reserves, at which time
	subsequent exploration costs and the costs incurred to develop a
	property are capitalized. Included in exploration costs are
	engineering and development costs associated with the Oyu Tolgoi
	Project located in Mongolia. Ivanhoe Mines expects to begin
	capitalizing Oyu Tolgoi development costs once the approved
	Investment Agreement&#146;s conditions precedent have been
	satisfied and the agreement has taken full effect.
</DIV>

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; WIDTH: 13%; ALIGN: LEFT; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PT SOLID #000000">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	In February 2005, Ivanhoe Mines sold the Savage River Iron Ore
	Project in Tasmania, Australia for two initial payments
	totalling $21.5&#160;million, plus a series of five contingent,
	annual payments that commenced on March&#160;31, 2006. The
	annual payments are based on annual iron ore pellet tonnes sold
	and an escalating price formula based on the prevailing annual
	Nibrasco/JSM pellet price.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	In 2009, Ivanhoe Mines received the fourth annual contingent
	payment of $38.7&#160;million. At December&#160;31, 2009 Ivanhoe
	Mines has accrued $20.9&#160;million in relation to the fifth
	contingent annual payment due in March 2010.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	To date, Ivanhoe Mines has received $137.9&#160;million in
	proceeds from the sale.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	During December 2009, Ivanhoe Mines sold the Indonesia Coal
	Division, which was composed entirely of the Mamahak Coal
	Project (&#147;Mamahak&#148;). Ivanhoe Mines divested its 85.0%
	interest in Mamahak to Kangaroo Resources Limited
	(&#147;Kangaroo&#148;) for consideration comprising of
	$1.0&#160;million cash and 50.0&#160;million shares of Kangaroo
	possessing a fair value of $8.8&#160;million. Ivanhoe Mines
	incurred transaction costs of $1.0&#160;million related to the
	disposition of Mamahak. As a result of this transaction, Ivanhoe
	Mines held 6.7% of the issued and outstanding shares of Kangaroo
	on December&#160;23, 2009, the closing date, and those shares
	are subject to a one year hold period.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 4%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	As a result of suspending operations at Mamahak in the third
	quarter of 2009, Ivanhoe Mines wrote-off the entire
	$23.3&#160;million carrying amount of Mamahak&#146;s inventory
	and property, plant and equipment. Loss from discontinued
	operations includes this write-off.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	13
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	(a)
</I>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	On October&#160;3, 2008, Ivanhoe Mines closed an agreement with
	several strategic partners whereby Altynalmas issued shares to
	acquire a 100% participating interest in BMV and a 100%
	participating interest in Intergold Capital LLP
	(&#147;IGC&#148;). Both IGC and BMV are limited liability
	partnerships established under the laws of Kazakhstan that are
	engaged in the exploration and development of minerals in
	Kazakhstan. As a result of this transaction, Ivanhoe Mines&#146;
	investment in Altynalmas was diluted to 49%. Ivanhoe Mines
	ceased consolidating Altynalmas on October&#160;3, 2008 and
	commenced equity accounting for its investment.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;

<TR>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	Amounts advanced to Altynalmas bear interest compounded monthly
	at a rate per annum equal to the one month London Inter-bank
	Offered Rate plus 3.0% and are due on demand.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	During 2009, Ivanhoe Mines recorded a $44,707,000
	(2008&#160;&#151; $6,268,000) equity loss on this investment.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	(b)
</I>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	During the first quarter of 2009, Ivanhoe Mines acquired
	1.8&#160;million shares of Exco Resources N.L.
	(&#147;Exco&#148;) at a cost of $113,000 (Aud$169,000) on the
	open market.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	During June 2009, Ivanhoe Mines acquired an additional
	5.1&#160;million shares of Exco at a cost of $965,000
	(Aud$1,199,000) by way of a private placement. In a subsequent
	private placement, during October 2009, Ivanhoe Mines acquired
	an additional 8.3&#160;million shares of Exco at a cost of
	$1,888,000 (Aud$2,041,000).
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	During May 2008, Ivanhoe Mines exercised its full option
	entitlement of 21.1&#160;million Exco share purchase options to
	acquire 21.1&#160;million shares of Exco at a cost of $6,926,000
	(Aud$7,392,000). Also during June 2008, Ivanhoe Mines acquired
	an additional 3.0&#160;million shares of Exco at a cost of
	$990,000 (Aud$1,050,000). As a result of these purchases and the
	subsequent appointment of an Ivanhoe Mines&#146; representative
	to the Board of Directors of Exco, Ivanhoe Mines commenced
	equity accounting for its investment in Exco on July&#160;1,
	2008.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	During 2009, Ivanhoe Mines recorded a $1,191,000
	(2008&#160;&#151; $3,015,000) equity loss on this investment.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	At December&#160;31, 2008, the carrying value of Ivanhoe
	Mines&#146; investment in Exco was greater than its share of the
	underlying book value of Exco&#146;s net assets by approximately
	$1,662,000 (Aud$2,572,000). This difference resulted in an
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP">
	other-than-temporary
</FONT>
	impairment charge on Ivanhoe Mines investment in Exco of
	$1,662,000.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	At December&#160;31, 2009, the market value of Ivanhoe
	Mines&#146; 20.2% investment in Exco was $13,291,000
	(Aud$14,806,000).
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	(i)

<TD>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	During 2009, Ivanhoe Mines acquired 22.6&#160;million common
	shares of Emmerson Resources Limited (&#147;Emmerson&#148;) and
	27.9&#160;million Emmerson share purchase options for a total
	cost of $2,141,000 (Aud$2,939,000). Each Emmerson share purchase
	option is exercisable until June&#160;1, 2011 to purchase an
	additional Emmerson common share at a price of Aud$0.20.
</TD>

<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	During 2009, Ivanhoe Mines disposed its remaining
	1.5&#160;million common shares of Jinshan Gold Mines Inc.
	(&#147;Jinshan&#148;) for $1,978,000. This transaction resulted
	in a gain of $1,424,000 being recognized.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>

<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	During 2008, Ivanhoe Mines exercised its full warrant
	entitlement of 1.5&#160;million Jinshan warrants to acquire
	1.5&#160;million shares of Jinshan at a cost of $3,776,000
	(Cdn$3,750,000).
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	Also during 2008, Ivanhoe Mines recorded an
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP">
	other-than-temporary
</FONT>
	impairment of $3,223,000 against this investment based on an
	assessment of the fair value of Jinshan.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	In May 2008, Ivanhoe Mines ceased equity accounting for its
	investment in Jinshan following the sale of 67.5&#160;million
	shares of Jinshan and the Jinshan note receivable for total
	proceeds of $216,730,000 (Cdn&#160;$217,662,000). This
	transaction resulted in a gain on sale of $201,428,000 being
	recognized.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>

<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

	its investment in Jinshan.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">

	42,500&#160;shares of GoviEx at a cost of $43,000.
</TD>

<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="TOP">
	(v)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	During 2009, Ivanhoe Mines acquired 1.2&#160;million common
	shares of Ivanhoe Nickel and Platinum Ltd.
	(&#147;Ivanplats&#148;) from third parties at a cost of
	$1,842,000. In addition, during December 2009, Ivanhoe Mines
	purchased 220,000 common shares of Ivanplats at a cost of
	$1,320,000 and 250,000 Ivanplats special warrants, convertible
	into 250,000 common shares of Ivanplats, at a cost of $1,500,000
	from certain directors of the Company.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	During November 2009, Ivanhoe Mines acquired 1.1&#160;million
	units of Ivanplats at a cost of $9,900,000. Each unit is
	comprised of one common share, one liquidity right and one-half
	of one initial public offering (&#147;IPO&#148;) warrant. Each
	liquidity right is convertible into 0.1 of an Ivanplats common
	share for no additional consideration in the event that a
	liquidity event does not occur on or before December&#160;31,
	2010. The 550,000 IPO warrants vest upon closing of an IPO. If
	an IPO occurs prior to December&#160;31, 2010, each IPO warrant
	entitles the holder to purchase one Ivanplats common share at
	the IPO price up until two years after the closing of the IPO.
	If an IPO occurs after December&#160;31, 2010, each IPO warrant
	entitles the holder to purchase 1.1 common shares of Ivanplats
	at the IPO price up until two years after the closing of the IPO.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	During 2008, Ivanhoe Mines acquired 1.0&#160;million common
	shares of Ivanplats and 3.4&#160;million Ivanplats special
	warrants in exchange for 2.2&#160;million common shares of
	Ivanhoe Mines.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	As at December&#160;31, 2009, Ivanhoe Mines held a 10.3% equity
	interest in Ivanplats on a fully diluted basis.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>

<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP">

</FONT>

	assessment of their fair values.
</TD>

<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	(a)&#160;&#160;Long-Term
	Notes
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	As at December&#160;31, 2008, the Company held
	$60.2&#160;million principal amount of non-bank-sponsored
	Asset-Backed Commercial Paper (&#147;Montreal
	Proposal&#160;ABCP&#148;) which was recorded at a fair value of
	$22.3&#160;million. On January&#160;12, 2009, the Ontario
	Superior Court of Justice granted the Amended Plan
	Implementation Order filed by the Pan-Canadian Restructuring
	Committee under the Companies&#146; Creditors Arrangement for
	the restructuring of the Montreal Proposal&#160;ABCP.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	On January&#160;21, 2009, the Amended Plan restructuring was
	completed. Upon closing of the Amended Plan, the Company
	received $60.2&#160;million of long-term investments (the
	&#147;Long-Term Notes&#148;) consisting of:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	As at December&#160;31, 2009, the Company held
	$65.2&#160;million of the Long-Term Notes. The increase from
	December 2008 in principal of $5.0&#160;million was due to the
	strengthening of the Canadian dollar ($7.2&#160;million), offset
	by principal redemptions ($2.2&#160;million). The Company has
	designated the Long-Term Notes as
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP">
	held-for-trading.
</FONT>
	The Long-Term Notes are recorded at fair value with unrealized
	holding gains and losses included in earnings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	There is a significant amount of uncertainty in estimating the
	amount and timing of cash flows associated with the Long-Term
	Notes. The Company has estimated the fair value of the Long-Term
	Notes considering information provided on the restructuring, the
	best available public information regarding market conditions
	and other factors that a market participant would consider for
	such investments.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The Company is aware of a limited number of trades in the
	Long-Term Notes that occurred prior to December&#160;31, 2009,
	but does not consider them to be of sufficient volume or value
	to constitute an active market. Accordingly, the Company has not
	used these trades to determine the fair value of its notes.
</DIV>

	17
</DIV>

	The Company has used a discounted cash flow approach to value
	the Long-Term Notes at December&#160;31, 2009 incorporating the

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Based on the discounted cash flow model as at December&#160;31,
	2009, the fair value of the Long-Term Notes was estimated at
	$24.7&#160;million. As a result of this valuation, the Company
	recorded an unrealized trading gain of $0.7&#160;million for the
	year ended December&#160;31, 2009.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Continuing uncertainties regarding the value of the assets that
	underlie the notes, the amount and timing of cash flows and
	changes in general economic conditions could give rise to a
	further change in the fair value of the Company&#146;s
	investment in the notes, which would impact the Company&#146;s
	results from operations. A 1.0% increase, representing
	100&#160;basis points, in the discount rate will decrease the
	fair value of the Long-Term Notes by approximately
	$1.4&#160;million.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	(b)&#160;&#160;Government
	of Mongolia Treasury Bills
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	On October&#160;6, 2009, Ivanhoe Mines agreed to purchase three
	Treasury Bills (&#147;T-Bills&#148;) from the Government of
	Mongolia, having an aggregate face value of $287.5&#160;million,
	for the aggregate sum of $250&#160;million. The annual rate of
	interest on the T-Bills is 3.0%. Each T-Bill will mature on the
	fifth anniversary from the date of its respective issuance.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	i.&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	The initial T-Bill, with a face value of $115&#160;million, was
	purchased on October&#160;20, 2009. The purchase price was
	$100&#160;million.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	ii.&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	A second T-Bill, with a face value of $57.5&#160;million, will
	be purchased for $50&#160;million within 14&#160;days of the
	satisfying of all conditions precedent to the Investment
	Agreement.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	iii.&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	The final T-Bill, having a face value of $115&#160;million, will
	be purchased for $100&#160;million within 14&#160;days of Oyu
	Tolgoi LLC fully drawing down the financing necessary to enable
	the complete construction of the Oyu Tolgoi Project, or
	June&#160;30, 2011, whichever date is earlier.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The Company has designated the T-Bills as
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP">
	available-for-sale
</FONT>
	with changes in fair value recognized in accumulated other
	comprehensive income. The fair value of the T-Bills are
	estimated based on available public information regarding what
	market participants would consider for such investments.
</DIV>

<P>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Notes to
	the Consolidated Financial Statements
<BR>
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	(Stated
	in U.S. dollars unless otherwise noted; tabular amounts in
	thousands)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="95%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	10.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	PROPERTY,
	PLANT AND EQUIPMENT (Continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; WIDTH: 13%; ALIGN: LEFT; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PT SOLID #000000">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	Ivanhoe Mines has a 100% interest in the Oyu Tolgoi copper-gold
	project located in Mongolia. In 2007, the Project&#146;s four
	mining licenses were re-issued as Special Permits for Mining,
	which are each valid for 30&#160;years and may be extended two
	times for 20&#160;years per extension.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	Capital works in progress at December&#160;31, 2009 consisted
	mainly of surface assets being constructed at Oyu Tolgoi for
	Shaft No.&#160;1, Shaft No.&#160;2, and the concentrator.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	A significant portion of exploration expenses incurred during
	the year relate directly to the development of Oyu Tolgoi.
	Included in exploration expenses are shaft sinking, engineering,
	and development costs that have been expensed and not
	capitalized (Note&#160;3).
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	SouthGobi holds a 100% interest in the Ovoot Tolgoi coal project
	located in Mongolia. In 2008, SouthGobi began open pit
	operations at Ovoot Tolgoi.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	Ivanhoe Mines through its majority owned subsidiary, Ivanhoe
	Australia, owns certain mining and exploration leases in
	Queensland, Australia, which contain prospective molybdenum,
	rhenium, copper, gold, zinc, silver and uranium occurrences.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	For the year ended December&#160;31, 2008, SouthGobi held a 85%
	working interest in the Mamahak coal project located in
	Indonesia. The Mamahak coal project was written-off in the third
	quarter of 2009 and subsequently sold in the fourth quarter
	(Note&#160;4 (b)).
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(e)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	In March 2010, Ivanhoe Mines and Rio Tinto completed an
	agreement whereby the Company issued 15&#160;million common
	shares to Rio Tinto for net proceeds of $241.1&#160;million
	(Cdn$244.7&#160;million). Ivanhoe Mines used $195.4&#160;million
	of the proceeds to purchase from Rio Tinto key mining and
	milling equipment to be installed during the construction of the
	Oyu Tolgoi Project (Note&#160;25 (a)).
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	Much of the equipment originally was ordered by Ivanhoe Mines
	from various manufacturers while it was waiting for an
	Investment Agreement with the Government of Mongolia. Ivanhoe
	Mines sold the equipment for $121.5&#160;million to Rio Tinto in
	August 2008 under an agreement between the companies. Additional
	equipment also was acquired by Rio Tinto directly from suppliers.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,N -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; WIDTH: 13%; ALIGN: LEFT; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PT SOLID #000000">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	In October 2007, Ivanhoe Mines obtained non-revolving bank loans
	which are due on demand and secured against certain securities
	and other investments.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	In December 2009, Ivanhoe Mines obtained a one year revolving
	line of credit facility, which is secured against certain
	equipment in Mongolia.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	In April 2009, Ivanhoe Mines obtained a non-revolving, two-year
	extendible loan facility, which is secured against certain
	securities and other investments.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage128"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Notes to
	the Consolidated Financial Statements
<BR>
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	(Stated
	in U.S. dollars unless otherwise noted; tabular amounts in
	thousands)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="95%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	14.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	CONVERTIBLE
	CREDIT FACILITIES (Continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	(a)&#160;&#160;Rio
	Tinto (Continued)
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In September 2007, Rio Tinto provided Ivanhoe Mines with a
	$350.0&#160;million convertible credit facility to finance
	ongoing mine development activities at the Oyu Tolgoi Project.
	In 2007, Ivanhoe Mines made an initial draw against the credit
	facility of $150.0&#160;million and further draws of
	$200&#160;million were made in 2008.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Amounts advanced under the credit facility bear interest at a
	rate per annum equal to the three-month London Inter-Bank
	Offered Rate plus 3.3%, and mature on September&#160;12, 2010.
	The outstanding principal amount and up to $108.0&#160;million
	in interest are convertible into a maximum of 45.8&#160;million
	common shares of Ivanhoe Mines at a price of $10.00 per share
	and will be automatically converted into common shares upon
	maturity.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	As part of the credit facility transaction, Rio Tinto also
	received share purchase warrants exercisable to purchase up to
	35.0&#160;million common shares of Ivanhoe Mines at a price of
	$10.00 per share for a period of five years (Note&#160;18 (c)).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Amounts drawn on the credit facility were allocated to the
	convertible credit facility liability and incremental
	exercisable share purchase warrants based on their respective
	fair values at the time of the draw. The existence of a
	beneficial conversion feature was then assessed using an
	effective conversion price based on the proceeds allocated to
	the convertible credit facility liability.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Allocating proceeds to share purchase warrants and, if
	necessary, a beneficial conversion feature resulted in discounts
	on the convertible credit facility liability. These discounts
	are recognized as accretion expense over the life of the credit
	facility using the effective interest rate method. Any
	unamortized balance of the beneficial conversion feature
	discount will be expensed immediately upon conversion of the
	credit facility.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The accounting treatment for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP">
	paid-in-kind
</FONT>
	interest is the same as that described above for amounts drawn
	on the credit facility.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	During 2009, Ivanhoe Mines capitalized $0.3&#160;million of
	interest expense and $0.3&#160;million of accretion expense
	incurred on the convertible credit facility.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	(b)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	China
	Investment Corporation
</FONT>
</I>
</B>

	&nbsp;

<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;

<TD NOWRAP ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	On November&#160;19, 2009, SouthGobi issued a convertible
	debenture to a wholly owned subsidiary of China Investment
	Corporation (&#147;CIC&#148;) for $500.0&#160;million. The
	convertible debenture is secured, bears interest at 8.0% and has
	a term of 30&#160;years. The financing primarily will support an
	accelerated investment program in Mongolia and up
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PARAGRAPH PAGEBREAK -->
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	22
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;

<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Notes to
	the Consolidated Financial Statements
<BR>
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	(Stated
	in U.S. dollars unless otherwise noted; tabular amounts in
	thousands)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="95%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	14.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	CONVERTIBLE
	CREDIT FACILITIES (Continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	(b)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	China
	Investment Corporation (Continued)
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	to $120.0&#160;million of the financing may also be used for
	working capital, repayment of debt due on funding, general and
	administrative expense and other general corporate purposes.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Key financial terms of the convertible debenture include:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	Interest&#160;&#151; 6.4% payable semi-annually in cash and 1.6%
	payable annually in shares of SouthGobi. The number of SouthGobi
	shares issued upon the settlement of interest is calculated
	using the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP">
	50-day
</FONT>
	volume-weighted average price (&#147;VWAP&#148;).
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	Term&#160;&#151; 30&#160;years.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	Security&#160;&#151; First charge over SouthGobi&#146;s assets,
	including shares of its material subsidiaries.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	Conversion price&#160;&#151; Lower of Cdn$11.88 or the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP">
	50-day
</FONT>
	VWAP
	at the date of conversion, subject to a floor price of Cdn$8.88
	per share.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	Investor&#146;s conversion option&#160;&#151; CIC has the right
	to convert the debenture, in whole or in part, into common
	shares of SouthGobi from November&#160;19, 2010 onwards.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	Issuer&#146;s conversion option&#160;&#151; SouthGobi has the
	right to convert up to $250.0&#160;million of the debenture on
	the earlier of November&#160;19, 2011 or upon achieving a public
	float of 25.0% of its common shares under certain agreed
	circumstances if the conversion price is at least Cdn$10.66.
	After November&#160;19, 2014, SouthGobi is entitled to convert
	the debenture, in whole or in part, into its common shares at
	the conversion price if the conversion price is at least
	Cdn$10.66.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The convertible debenture is a hybrid instrument containing a
	debt host contract and three embedded derivatives: the
	investor&#146;s conversion option, issuer&#146;s conversion
	option and share-based interest payment provision. These
	embedded derivatives were bifurcated from the debt host
	contract, measured at fair value and bundled together as a
	single compound embedded derivative liability. Each reporting
	period the embedded derivative liability is remeasured at fair
	value with changes in fair value being recognized in earnings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The initial $186.7&#160;million carrying amount of the debt host
	contract is the residual principal amount after bifurcating the
	$313.3&#160;million fair value of the embedded derivative
	liability. A debt discount arises due to the difference between
	the initial carrying amount of the debt host contract and the
	amount payable at maturity.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Transaction costs of $15.0&#160;million were allocated between
	the embedded derivative liability and debt host contract in
	proportion to the allocation of the total proceeds between the
	two components. The $9.4&#160;million allocated to the embedded
	derivative liability was expensed immediately. Whereas, the
	$5.6&#160;million allocated to the debt host contract is
	reported in the balance sheet as a deferred charge.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Both the debt discount and deferred charge are amortized as
	accretion expense over the 30&#160;year contractual life of the
	convertible debenture using the interest method.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The embedded derivative liability was valued using a Monte Carlo
	simulation valuation model. A Monte Carlo simulation model is a
	valuation model that relies on random sampling and is often used
	when modeling systems with a large number of inputs and where
	there is significant uncertainty in the future value of inputs
	and where the movement in the inputs can be independent of each
	other. Some of the key inputs used by the Monte Carlo simulation
	include: floor and ceiling conversion prices, risk-free rate of
	return, expected volatility of SouthGobi&#146;s share price,
	forward Cdn$ exchange rate curves and spot Cdn$ exchange rates.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	As at December&#160;31, 2009, the fair value of the embedded
	derivative liability was determined to be $358.3&#160;million.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	23
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

	Assumptions used in the Monte Carlo valuation model are as
	follows:

<!-- XBRL,N -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="95%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	15.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	DERIVATIVE
	CONTRACT
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,BODY -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In November 2008, Ivanhoe Mines entered into a Share Purchase
	Agreement with a third party (the &#147;Transferor&#148;) to
	acquire two million shares of SouthGobi for an initial payment
	of $7.0&#160;million. Contemporaneously, Ivanhoe Mines entered
	into an Option Agreement which provides the Transferor with the
	option to acquire up to two million SouthGobi shares from
	Ivanhoe Mines at any time on or before the third anniversary of
	the agreements at an escalating price agreed upon in the Option
	Agreement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	At the time of entering into the contract, the Option Agreement
	was considered a freestanding contract indexed to the stock of a
	consolidated subsidiary and was initially recorded as a
	liability at fair value and subsequently marked to fair value
	through earnings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The fair value of the option was determined using a
	Black-Scholes option pricing model, using the following
	assumptions at December&#160;31, 2008:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	During 2008, Ivanhoe Mines recorded a derivative loss of
	$3.2&#160;million on the Option Agreement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The adoption of the updated ASC guidance for an instrument (or
	an embedded feature) with a settlement amount that is based on
	the stock of an entity&#146;s consolidated subsidiary resulted
	in the reclassification of the fair value of the derivative
	contract to noncontrolling interests on January&#160;1, 2009
	(Note&#160;20). Any subsequent changes to the fair value of the
	derivative contract will no longer be recorded through earnings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	During 2009, the Transferor exercised their option to acquire
	1,025,000 SouthGobi shares. As a result, a portion of the
	carrying amount of the derivative contract has been removed from
	noncontrolling interests (Note&#160;20).
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,N -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>

	As referred to in Note&#160;2(b), Ivanhoe Mines must make
	significant estimates in respect of its provision for income
	taxes and the composition of its deferred income tax assets and
	liabilities. Ivanhoe Mines&#146; operations are, in part,
	subject to foreign tax laws where interpretations, regulations
	and legislation are complex and continually changing. As a
	result, there are usually some tax matters in question that may,
	upon resolution in the future, result in
</DIV>

	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	Translated using the year-end exchange rate.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	These losses are carried forward indefinitely, subject to
	continuity of ownership and business tests.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	These losses are carried forward until production from a mine
	commences; thereafter, they can be amortized on a straight-line
	basis.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	These losses are carried forward indefinitely for utilization
	against future net realized capital gains.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Ivanhoe Mines also has deductible temporary differences and
	unused tax losses in certain other foreign jurisdictions that
	are not disclosed above, as it is currently highly unlikely that
	these items will be utilized.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Ivanhoe Mines had no unrecognized tax benefits as of
	December&#160;31, 2009 and 2008. Under current conditions and
	expectations, management does not foresee any significant
	changes in unrecognized tax benefits that would have a material
	impact on the Company&#146;s financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	During 2009 and 2008, Ivanhoe Mines did not recognize any
	accrued interest or penalties related to unrecognized tax
	benefits within the statement of operations or balance sheet.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

	Balance, end of year
</DIV>

</TD>

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The total undiscounted amount of estimated cash flows required
	to settle the obligations is $21.9&#160;million
	(2008&#160;&#151; $20.1&#160;million), which has been discounted
	using credit adjusted risk free rates ranging from 5.6% to
	11.3%. The majority of reclamation obligations are not expected
	to be paid for several years and will be funded from Ivanhoe
	Mines&#146; cash balances and environmental bonds restricted for
	the purpose of settling asset retirement obligations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="93%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	18.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	SHARE
	CAPITAL
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;(a)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Equity
	Incentive Plan
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The Company has an Employees&#146; and Directors&#146; Equity
	Incentive Plan (the &#147;Equity Incentive Plan&#148;), which
	includes three components: (i)&#160;a Share Option Plan;
	(ii)&#160;a Share Bonus Plan; and (iii)&#160;a Share Purchase
	Plan.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(i)&#160;The Share Option Plan authorizes the Board of Directors
	of the Company to grant options to directors and employees of
	Ivanhoe Mines to acquire Common Shares of the Company at a price
	based on the weighted average trading price of the Common Shares
	for the five days preceding the date of the grant. Options vest
	over four years and have seven year contractual terms unless
	otherwise determined from time to time by the Board of
	Directors, on the recommendation of the Compensation and
	Benefits Committee. The Share Option Plan also provides that
	these options may, upon approval of the Board of Directors, be
	converted into stock appreciation rights.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(ii)&#160;The Share Bonus Plan permits the Board of Directors of
	the Company to authorize the issuance, from time to time, of
	Common Shares of the Company to employees of the Company and its
	affiliates.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(iii)&#160;The Share Purchase Plan entitles each eligible
	employee of Ivanhoe Mines to contribute up to seven percent of
	each employee&#146;s annual basic salary in semi-monthly
	instalments. At the end of each calendar quarter, each employee
	participating in the Share Purchase Plan is issued Common Shares
	of the Company equal to 1.5 times the aggregate amount
	contributed by the participant, based on the weighted average
	trading price of the Common Shares during the preceding three
	months.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The Company is authorized to issue a maximum of 6.5% of the
	issued and outstanding Common Shares (December&#160;31,
	2009&#160;&#151; 27,654,091) pursuant to the Equity Incentive
	Plan. At December&#160;31, 2009, an aggregate of 6,495,821
	Common Shares were available for future grants of awards under
	the plan.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The fair value of each option award is estimated on the date of
	grant using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model. The
	Black-Scholes option-pricing model requires the input of
	subjective assumptions, including the expected term of the
	option award and stock price volatility. The expected term of
	options granted is derived from historical data on employee
	exercise and post-vesting employment termination behaviour.
	Expected volatility is based on the historical volatility of the
	Company&#146;s stock. These estimates involve inherent
	uncertainties and the application of management judgment. In
	addition, the Company is required to estimate the expected
	forfeiture rate
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PARAGRAPH PAGEBREAK -->
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	27
</DIV>

	and only recognize expense for those options expected to vest.
	As a result, if other assumptions had been used, the recorded
	stock-based compensation expense could have been materially
	different from that reported.

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;

	The weighted average grant-date fair value of stock options
	granted during 2009 and 2008 was Cdn$5.08 and Cdn$2.50,
	respectively. The fair value of these options was determined
	using a Black-Scholes option pricing model, recognizing
	forfeitures as they occur, using the following weighted average
	assumptions:

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	At December&#160;31, 2009, the U.S.&#160;dollar equivalent of
	the weighted average exercise price was $8.39 (December&#160;31,
	2008&#160;&#151; $7.42).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The total intrinsic value of options exercised during the years
	ended December&#160;31, 2009 and 2008 was $4.7&#160;million and
	$3.6&#160;million, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	As at December&#160;31, 2009, options vested and expected to
	vest totalled 21,158,270 (December&#160;31, 2008&#160;&#151;
	18,810,470) and had an aggregate intrinsic value of
	$132.1&#160;million (December&#160;31, 2008&#160;&#151;
	$0.9&#160;million).
</DIV>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	28
</DIV>

<P>
<A NAME="eolPage135"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>

	total unrecognized compensation cost related to unvested stock
	options. This cost is expected to be recognized over a
	weighted-average period of approximately 1.7&#160;years.
