<P>
<A NAME="eolPage136"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Notes to
	the Consolidated Financial Statements
<BR>
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	(Stated
	in U.S. dollars unless otherwise noted; tabular amounts in
	thousands)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	18.&#160;&#160;SHARE
	CAPITAL (Continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;(b)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Rio
	Tinto Placement
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In 2006, Ivanhoe Mines and Rio Tinto formed a strategic
	partnership whereby Rio Tinto would invest in Ivanhoe Mines.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In October 2006, Rio Tinto completed a first private placement
	tranche under the agreement by purchasing approximately
	37.1&#160;million shares at a price of $8.18 per share, for
	proceeds totalling $303.4&#160;million.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In October 2009, Rio Tinto completed the second private
	placement tranche under the agreement, consisting of
	46.3&#160;million shares at a price of $8.38 per share, for
	proceeds totalling $388.0&#160;million. As a result, the
	$5.2&#160;million carrying amount of the share issuance
	commitment was reclassified to share capital. This financing
	increased Rio Tinto&#146;s equity ownership in the Company from
	9.9% to 19.7%.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In March 2010, Ivanhoe Mines issued 15.0&#160;million shares to
	Rio Tinto at Cdn$16.31 per share, for total proceeds of
	$241.1&#160;million (Cdn$244.7&#160;million) (Note&#160;10
	(e)&#160;and 25 (a)).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In addition to the first and second private placement tranches,
	Rio Tinto was granted 92,053,044 warrants, divided into two
	series. The lives of these warrants are determined by the date
	an approved Investment Agreement is reached. The Warrant
	Determination Date within the warrant terms presented below is
	the earlier of the date an approved Investment Agreement is
	reached or October&#160;27, 2009.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The 46,026,522 Series&#160;A Warrants are non-transferable. Each
	warrant entitles Rio Tinto to purchase one Common Share of the
	Company at a price of:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(i)&#160;$8.38 during the period commencing November&#160;30,
	2006 and ending 180&#160;days following the Warrant
	Determination Date;&#160;and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(ii)&#160;$8.54 during the period commencing 181&#160;days after
	the Warrant Determination Date and ending 365&#160;days after
	the Warrant Determination Date.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The 46,026,522 Series&#160;B Warrants are non-transferable. Each
	warrant entitles Rio Tinto to purchase one Common Share of the
	Company at a price of:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(i)&#160;$8.38 during the period commencing November&#160;30,
	2006 and ending 180&#160;days following the Warrant
	Determination Date;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(ii)&#160;$8.54 during the period commencing 181&#160;days after
	the Warrant Determination Date and ending 365&#160;days after
	the Warrant Determination Date;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(iii)&#160;$8.88 during the period commencing 366&#160;days
	after the Warrant Determination Date and ending 545&#160;days
	after the Warrant Determination Date;&#160;and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(iv)&#160;$9.02 during the period commencing 546&#160;days after
	the Warrant Determination Date and ending 725&#160;days after
	the Warrant Determination Date.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	During 2008, Rio Tinto received 243,772&#160;shares and
	1,440,406 additional share purchase warrants (the
	&#147;Anti-Dilution Warrants&#148;), divided into two series.
	The lives of the Anti-Dilution Warrants are identical to the
	Series&#160;A Warrants and Series&#160;B Warrants above. Each
	Anti-Dilution Warrant entitles Rio Tinto to purchase one Common
	Share of the Company at a price of Cdn$3.15.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Ivanhoe Mines has recorded an amount of $23.1&#160;million in
	shareholders&#146; equity, attributable to the fair value of the
	Rio Tinto share purchase warrants and second tranche share
	issuance commitment. As at December&#160;31, 2009, all of the
	Series&#160;A Warrants, Series&#160;B Warrants and Anti-Dilution
	Warrants were outstanding.
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	30
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

	As part of the credit facility transaction disclosed in
	Note&#160;14 (a), Rio Tinto received share purchase warrants
	exercisable to purchase up to 35.0&#160;million common shares of
	Ivanhoe Mines at a price of $10.00 per share at any time on or
	before October&#160;24, 2012. As at December&#160;31, 2009,
	35.0&#160;million share purchase warrants were exercisable.

	The following tables summarize related party expenses incurred
	by Ivanhoe Mines, primarily on a cost-recovery basis, with an
	officer of a subsidiary of Ivanhoe Mines, a company subject to
	significant influence by Ivanhoe Mines, a company affiliated
	with Ivanhoe Mines, or with companies related by way of

</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Accounts receivable and accounts payable at December&#160;31,
	2009, included $676,000 and $4,840,000, respectively
	(December&#160;31, 2008&#160;&#151; $142,000 and $3,217,000,
	respectively), which were due from/to a company under common
	control, a company affiliated with Ivanhoe Mines, or companies
	related by way of directors in common.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	34
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(a)&#160;Global Mining Management Corporation
	(&#147;Global&#148;) is a private company based in Vancouver
	owned equally by seven companies, one of which is Ivanhoe Mines.
	Global has a director in common with the Company. Global
	provides administration, accounting, and other office services
	to the Company on a cost-recovery basis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(b)&#160;Ivanhoe Capital Aviation LLC (&#147;Aviation&#148;) is
	a private company 100% owned by the Company&#146;s Chairman.
	Aviation operates an aircraft which is rented by the Company on
	a cost-recovery basis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(c)&#160;An officer of a subsidiary of Ivanhoe Mines is a
	partner with Fognani&#160;&#038; Faught, PLLC, a legal firm
	which provides legal services to Ivanhoe Mines.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(d)&#160;Ivanhoe Capital Corporation (&#147;ICC&#148;) is a
	private company 100% owned by the Company&#146;s Chairman. ICC
	provides administration and other office services in London on a
	cost-recovery basis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(e)&#160;Ivanhoe Capital Services Ltd. (&#147;ICS&#148;) is a
	private company 100% owned by the Company&#146;s Chairman. ICS
	provides management services out of Singapore and London on a
	cost-recovery basis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(f)&#160;Rio Tinto owns 19.7% of Ivanhoe Mines. Rio Tinto
	provides engineering related services for the Oyu Tolgoi Project
	on a cost-recovery basis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Ivanplats is a private company 34% owned by the Company&#146;s
	Chairman. During 2009, Ivanhoe Mines purchased common shares,
	warrants and units of Ivanplats (Note&#160;8 (c)(v)).
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	During the year ended December&#160;31, 2009, all of the coal
	division&#146;s revenue arose from coal sales in Mongolia to two
	customers. Total revenues by customer were $23.0&#160;million
	and $13.0&#160;million.
</DIV>

	36

<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	During the year ended December&#160;31, 2008, all of the coal
	division&#146;s revenue arose from coal sales in Mongolia to two
	customers. Total revenues by customer were $1.9&#160;million and
	$1.2&#160;million
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; WIDTH: 13%; ALIGN: LEFT; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PT SOLID #000000">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	In March 2010, Ivanhoe Mines used $195.4&#160;million of the
	$241.1&#160;million of proceeds received from the issue of
	15&#160;million common shares to purchase from Rio Tinto key
	mining and milling equipment to be installed during the
	construction of the Oyu Tolgoi Project.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	On October&#160;6, 2009, Ivanhoe Mines agreed to purchase three
	T-Bills from the Government of Mongolia having an aggregate face
	value of $287.5&#160;million, for the aggregate sum of
	$250&#160;million. Ivanhoe Mines purchased the initial
	$100&#160;million T-Bill on October&#160;20, 2009 and is
	committed to purchase the second $50&#160;million T-Bill within
	14&#160;days of the conditions precedent to the Investment
	Agreement having been addressed and purchase the final
	$100&#160;million T-Bill within 14&#160;days of having fully
	drawn the financing necessary to enable the full and complete
	construction of the Oyu Tolgoi Project or June&#160;30, 2011,
	whichever date is earlier.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,N -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="95%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	26.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	FAIR
	VALUE ACCOUNTING
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL,BODY -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The ASC establishes a fair value hierarchy that prioritizes the
	inputs to valuation techniques used to measure fair value. The
	hierarchy gives the highest priority to unadjusted quoted prices
	in active markets for identical assets or liabilities and the
	lowest priority to unobservable inputs. The three levels of the
	fair value hierarchy are as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 4%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	Level&#160;1:
</I>
	&#160;&#160;Quoted prices in active markets
	for identical assets or liabilities that the reporting entity
	has the ability to access at the measurement date.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 4%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	Level&#160;2:
</I>
	&#160;&#160;Quoted prices in markets that
	are not active, or inputs that are observable, either directly
	or indirectly, for substantially the full term of the asset or
	liability.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	38
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage145"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Notes to
	the Consolidated Financial Statements
<BR>
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	(Stated
	in U.S. dollars unless otherwise noted; tabular amounts in
	thousands)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="95%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	26.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	FAIR
	VALUE ACCOUNTING (Continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 4%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	Level&#160;3:
</I>
	&#160;&#160;Prices or valuation techniques
	that require inputs that are both significant to the fair value
	measurement and unobservable.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The following table sets forth the Company&#146;s assets and
	liabilities measured at fair value on a recurring basis by level
	within the fair value hierarchy. Assets and liabilities are
	classified in their entirety based on the lowest level of input
	that is significant to the fair value measurement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The Company&#146;s short-term and long-term investments are
	classified within Level&#160;1 and 2 of the fair value hierarchy
	as they are valued using quoted market prices of certain
	investments, as well as quoted prices for similar investments.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The Company&#146;s other long-term investments are classified
	within Level&#160;1 and 3 of the fair value hierarchy and
	consist of Long-Term Notes received upon the completion of the
	Asset-Backed Commercial Paper restructuring, Government of
	Mongolia T-Bills and money market investments.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The Company&#146;s embedded derivative liability, included
	within convertible credit facilities (Note&#160;14 (b)), is
	classified within Level&#160;2 of the fair value hierarchy as it
	is determined using a Monte Carlo simulation valuation model,
	which uses readily observable market inputs.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	39
</DIV>

<P>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">

	(a)&#160;The estimated fair value of Ivanhoe Mines&#146;
	financial instruments was as follows:

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The fair value of Ivanhoe Mines&#146; long-term investments was
	determined by reference to published market quotations, which
	may not be reflective of future values.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The fair value of Ivanhoe Mines&#146; other long-term
	investments, consisting of Long-Term Notes, T-Bills and money
	market investments, was determined by considering the best
	available data regarding market conditions for such investments,
	which may not be reflective of future values.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The fair value of the Rio Tinto convertible credit facility was
	estimated to approximate the balance of principal and interest
	outstanding, due primarily to the short-term maturity of this
	facility.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The fair value of the CIC convertible debenture was estimated to
	approximate the aggregate carrying amount of the CIC convertible
	credit facility liability and interest payable. This aggregate
	carrying amount includes the
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PARAGRAPH PAGEBREAK -->
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	40
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>

	the Consolidated Financial Statements

	in U.S. dollars unless otherwise noted; tabular amounts in

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">

<TR VALIGN="TOP">

	DISCLOSURES
	REGARDING FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS (Continued)
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	estimated fair value of the embedded derivative liability which
	was determined using a Monte Carlo simulation valuation model.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The fair values of Ivanhoe Mines&#146; remaining financial
	instruments were estimated to approximate their carrying values,
	due primarily to the immediate or short-term maturity of these
	financial instruments.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(b)&#160;Ivanhoe Mines is exposed to credit risk with respect to
	its accounts receivable. The significant concentrations of
	credit risk are situated in Mongolia and Australia. Ivanhoe
	Mines does not mitigate the balance of this risk in light of the
	credit worthiness of its major debtors.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(c)&#160;Ivanhoe Mines is exposed to interest rate risk with
	respect to the variable rates of interest incurred on the Rio
	Tinto convertible credit facility (Note&#160;14 (a)) and amounts
	due under credit facilities (Note&#160;13). Interest rate risk
	is concentrated in Canada. Ivanhoe Mines does not mitigate the
	balance of this risk.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL,N -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(a)&#160;On January&#160;29, 2010, SouthGobi successfully
	completed an international offering of 27&#160;million shares
	for gross proceeds of Cdn$459.0&#160;million. Simultaneously,
	with the international offering, SouthGobi&#146;s shares began
	trading on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange under the ticker HKEX:
	1878.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	(b)&#160;On March&#160;29, 2010, CIC, at SouthGobi&#146;s
	request, converted $250.0&#160;million of its convertible
	debenture (Note&#160;14 (b)) into shares of SouthGobi at a
	conversion price of Cdn$11.88. As a result of the conversion and
	the international offering, Ivanhoe Mines&#146; ownership
	interest in SouthGobi was reduced to 57.4%.
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage149"></A>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
<BR>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION
	AND
<BR>
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
<BR>
	(Stated in U.S. dollars, except where noted)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	INTRODUCTION
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	This discussion and analysis of the financial condition and
	results of operations (MD&#038;A) of Ivanhoe Mines Ltd. should
	be read in conjunction with the audited consolidated financial
	statements of Ivanhoe Mines Ltd. and the notes thereto for the
	year ended December&#160;31, 2009. These financial statements
	have been prepared in accordance with United States of America
	generally accepted accounting principles (U.S.&#160;GAAP). In
	this MD&#038;A, unless the context otherwise dictates, a
	reference to the Company refers to Ivanhoe Mines Ltd. and a
	reference to Ivanhoe Mines refers to Ivanhoe Mines Ltd.,
	together with its subsidiaries. Additional information about the
	Company, including its Annual Information Form, is available at
<U>
	www.sedar.com
</U>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	References to &#147;C$&#148; refer to Canadian dollars,
	&#147;A$&#148; to Australian dollars, and &#147;$&#148; to
	United States dollars.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	This discussion and analysis contains forward-looking
	statements. Please refer to the cautionary language on
	page&#160;44.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The effective date of this MD&#038;A is March&#160;31, 2010.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	OVERVIEW
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	HIGHLIGHTS
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	On March&#160;31, 2010, Ivanhoe Mines announced the
	successful completion of the conditions precedent that had been
	incorporated into the landmark Investment Agreement to build and
	operate the Oyu Tolgoi copper-gold mining complex in
	Mongolia&#146;s South Gobi Region, giving the agreement full
	legal effect.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	Ivanhoe Mines, with its subsidiary, Oyu Tolgoi LLC (OT LLC),
	and its strategic partner, Rio Tinto, signed and approved the
	long-awaited Investment Agreement with the Government of
	Mongolia in October&#160;2009, establishing a comprehensive
	framework for maintaining a stable tax and operating environment
	for the construction and operation of the Oyu Tolgoi Project.
	The signing culminated nine years of exploration successes that
	have established Oyu Tolgoi as one of the world&#146;s largest,
	undeveloped copper-gold porphyry projects, and nearly
	six&#160;years of negotiations with the Government of Mongolia
	for an Investment Agreement.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	Provisions of the Investment Agreement include protection of
	the parties&#146; investments in the Oyu Tolgoi Project, the
	amount and term of the parties&#146; investments in the Oyu
	Tolgoi Project, the right to realize the benefits of such
	investments, the conduct of mining with minimum environmental
	impact and progressive rehabilitation, the social and economic
	development of the South Gobi Region and the creation of
	thousands of new jobs in Mongolia.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	Mongolia&#146;s state-owned company, Erdenes MGL LLC, will
	acquire a 34% interest in the Oyu Tolgoi Project within
	14&#160;days of the approved Investment Agreement taking effect.
	Ivanhoe Mines will retain a controlling 66% interest in OT
	LLC.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	Given the extent of the mineral discoveries associated with
	the Oyu Tolgoi Project and the potential for additional
	discoveries, Ivanhoe Mines and the Government of Mongolia agreed
	that the approved Investment Agreement should conform with the
	provision of Mongolia&#146;s current Minerals Law specifying
	that certain deposits of strategic importance qualify for
	30&#160;years of stabilized tax rates and regulatory provisions,
	with an option of extending the term of the Investment Agreement
	for an additional 20&#160;years. Major taxes and rates
	stabilized for the life of the agreement include: corporate
	income tax, customs duty, value-added tax; excise tax;
	royalties; exploration and mining licences; and immovable
	property
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP">
	and/or
</FONT>
	real
	estate tax.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	1
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage150"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
<A HREF="#O59368EXV3_HTM_TOCPAGE">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
<BR>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION
	AND
<BR>
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
<BR>
	(Stated in U.S. dollars, except where noted)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	In late 2009, the joint Ivanhoe Mines-Rio Tinto Oyu Tolgoi
	Technical Committee conditionally approved a $758.0&#160;million
	budget for 2010 to begin full-scale construction of Oyu Tolgoi.
	The 2010 budget provides for an early start on a site-wide
	development program.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	In March 2010, Ivanhoe Mines issued 15.0&#160;million common
	shares to Rio Tinto at C$16.31 per share for total proceeds of
	C$244.7&#160;million ($241.1&#160;million). Ivanhoe Mines used
	$195.4&#160;million of the proceeds received to purchase from
	Rio Tinto key mining and milling equipment to be installed
	during the construction of the Oyu Tolgoi mining complex. With
	the transaction, Rio Tinto increased its ownership in Ivanhoe
	Mines from 19.6% to 22.4%. Acquisition of the equipment is
	another significant step in building one of the world&#146;s
	largest copper-gold mines.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	In late 2009, Ivanhoe Mines completed the first comprehensive
	field test of the
	Zeus
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	TM
</SUP>
</B>
<B>
	proprietary, induced polarization and resistivity (IP)
	technology, a technological breakthrough that has significantly
	increased the potential for additional gold and copper resources
	to be discovered at the Oyu Tolgoi Project.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	Ivanhoe Mines&#146;&#160;57%-owned subsidiary, SouthGobi
	Energy Resources (SouthGobi), shipped approximately
	1.3&#160;million tonnes of coal from its Ovoot Tolgoi Mine in
	southern Mongolia at an average realized selling price of
	approximately $29 per tonne. This compares to 0.1&#160;million
	tonnes of coal shipped in 2008 at an average realized selling
	price of $29 per tonne. This resulted in $36.0&#160;million of
	revenue being recognized in 2009 compared to $3.1&#160;million
	in 2008.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	On January&#160;29, 2010, SouthGobi closed a global equity
	offering of 27.0&#160;million common shares at a price of
	C$17.00 per common share, for gross proceeds of
	C$459.0&#160;million to expand SouthGobi&#146;s coal mining and
	exploration activities in southern Mongolia. SouthGobi also
	commenced trading on the Main Board of the Hong Kong Stock
	Exchange (HK: 1878), the first Canadian mining company to have
	dual listings on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange and the Toronto
	Stock Exchange.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	In November 2009, SouthGobi entered into a financing
	agreement with a wholly-owned subsidiary of China Investment
	Corporation for $500.0&#160;million in the form of a secured,
	convertible debenture.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	Ivanhoe Mines&#146; 81%-owned subsidiary, Ivanhoe Australia
	(IVA&#160;&#151; ASX), discovered a new, high-grade molybdenum
	and rhenium deposit at its Merlin Project on its Cloncurry
	tenements in northwestern Queensland.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	Ivanhoe Mines, through its 50% interest in Altynalmas Gold
	Ltd., is advancing the Kyzyl Gold Project in Kazakhstan, one of
	the world&#146;s largest undeveloped gold projects. Altynalmas
	has completed 21,800 metres of a 39,000-metre deep-level
	drilling program that is intended to upgrade the mineral
	resource.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	In 2009, Ivanhoe Mines incurred $177.1&#160;million in
	exploration and development activities, compared to
	$250.6&#160;million in 2008. In 2009, Ivanhoe Mines&#146;
	exploration activities were largely focused in Mongolia and
	Australia.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	2
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<A NAME='O59368EXV3_HTM_102'>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	REVIEW OF
	OPERATIONS
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Ivanhoe Mines is an international exploration and development
	company with activities concentrated in Central Asia and the
	Asia Pacific Region. The Company&#146;s principal assets include:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	The Oyu Tolgoi Copper and Gold Project in southern Mongolia,
	presently 100%-owned by Ivanhoe Mines. Ivanhoe Mines&#146;
	ownership will be reduced to 66% as Mongolia&#146;s state-owned
	company, Erdenes MGL LLC (Erdenes), will acquire a 34% interest
	in the Oyu Tolgoi Project within 14&#160;days of the approved
	Investment Agreement taking effect.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	A&#160;57% interest in SouthGobi Energy Resources, which is
	producing and selling coal from its Ovoot Tolgoi Mine in
	southern Mongolia to customers in China and is conducting
	ongoing exploration and development programs at several other
	Mongolian coal prospects.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	An 81% interest in Ivanhoe Australia, which owns the Merlin
	Project, a high-grade molybdenum and rhenium deposit in
	Queensland, Australia. Ivanhoe Australia also is continuing to
	explore and advance its Iron-Oxide-Copper-Gold (IOCG) projects
	in the Cloncurry region.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	4
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<A HREF="#O59368EXV3_HTM_TOCPAGE">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
<BR>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION
	AND
<BR>
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
<BR>
	(Stated in U.S. dollars, except where noted)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	A 50% interest in Altynalmas Gold, which owns the Kyzyl Gold
	Project that hosts the Bakyrchik and Bolshevik Gold Deposits in
	Kazakhstan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In 2009, Ivanhoe Mines recorded a net loss of
	$280.2&#160;million (or $0.72 per share), compared to a net loss
	of $184.1&#160;million (or $0.49 per share) in 2008,
	representing an increase of $96.1&#160;million. Results for 2009
	were mainly affected by $177.1&#160;million in exploration
	expenses, $45.8&#160;million in general and administrative
	expenses, $21.6&#160;million in interest expense,
	$45.0&#160;million in a change in fair value of embedded
	derivatives and $45.9&#160;million in a share of losses of
	significantly influenced investees. These amounts were offset by
	coal revenue of $36.0&#160;million and $34.1&#160;million in
	mainly unrealized foreign exchange gains.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Exploration expenses of $177.1&#160;million in 2009 decreased
	$73.5&#160;million from $250.6&#160;million in 2008. The
	exploration expenses included $130.9&#160;million spent in
	Mongolia ($197.6&#160;million in 2008), primarily for Oyu Tolgoi
	and Ovoot Tolgoi, and $41.5&#160;million incurred by Ivanhoe
	Australia ($46.5&#160;million in 2008). Exploration costs are
	charged to operations in the period incurred and often represent
	the bulk of Ivanhoe Mines&#146; operating loss for that period.
	Ivanhoe Mines expects to commence capitalizing Oyu Tolgoi
	development costs in the second quarter of 2010.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Ivanhoe Mines&#146; cash position, on a consolidated basis at
	December&#160;31, 2009, was $965.8&#160;million. As at
	March&#160;31, 2010, Ivanhoe Mines&#146; current consolidated
	cash position is approximately $1.3&#160;billion.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	A.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<A NAME='O59368EXV3_HTM_103'>
</A>
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	EXPLORATION
	ACTIVITIES
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In 2009, Ivanhoe Mines expensed $177.1&#160;million in
	exploration and development activities, compared to
	$250.6&#160;million in 2008. In 2009, Ivanhoe Mines&#146;
	exploration and development activities were largely focused in
	Mongolia and Australia.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	MONGOLIA
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	OYU
	TOLGOI COPPER-GOLD PROJECT
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The Oyu Tolgoi Project is approximately 550 kilometres south of
	Ulaanbaatar and 80 kilometres north of the Mongolia-China
	border. Mineralization on the property consists of
	porphyry-style copper, gold and molybdenum contained in a linear
	structural trend (the Oyu Tolgoi Trend), with a strike length
	that extends over 20 kilometres. Mineral resources have been
	identified in a series of deposits throughout this trend. They
	include, from south to
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PARAGRAPH PAGEBREAK -->
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	5
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage154"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
<A HREF="#O59368EXV3_HTM_TOCPAGE">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
<BR>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION
	AND
<BR>
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
<BR>
	(Stated in U.S. dollars, except where noted)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	north, the Heruga Deposit, the Southern Oyu deposits (Southwest
	Oyu, South Oyu, Wedge and Central Oyu), and the Hugo Dummett
	Deposit (Hugo South, Hugo North and Hugo North Extension). In
	March 2010, an updated Oyu Tolgoi Technical Report prepared by
	AMEC Minproc Limited (formerly GRD Minproc Limited) was
	released. This estimate can be found in the 2010 Annual
	Information Form on
<U>
	www.sedar.com
</U>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In 2009, Ivanhoe Mines incurred exploration expenses of
	$107.4&#160;million at Oyu Tolgoi, compared to the
	$156.0&#160;million incurred in 2008. A significant portion of
	the 2009 expenditures was related directly to development work.
	Ivanhoe Mines expects to begin capitalizing Oyu Tolgoi
	development costs in the second quarter of 2010.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Rio Tinto
	increased its interest in Ivanhoe Mines to 22.4%
</FONT>
</I>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In March 2010, Ivanhoe Mines issued 15.0&#160;million common
	shares to Rio Tinto at C$16.31 per share for total proceeds of
	C$244.7&#160;million ($241.1&#160;million). Ivanhoe Mines used
	C$198.2&#160;million ($195.4&#160;million) of the proceeds to
	purchase from Rio Tinto key mining and milling equipment to be
	installed during the construction of the Oyu Tolgoi Project.
	Ivanhoe Mines will use the balance of the proceeds,
	C$46.4&#160;million ($45.7&#160;million) to purchase additional
	equipment and for general corporate purposes. With this
	transaction, Rio Tinto has increased its ownership in Ivanhoe
	Mines from 19.6% to 22.4%.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In October 2009, Rio Tinto had also increased its ownership
	interest in Ivanhoe Mines when it completed Tranche&#160;2 of
	the original October 2006 private placement
	financing&#160;&#151; consisting of 46,304,473 Ivanhoe Mines
	shares at $8.38 per share&#160;&#151; for proceeds to Ivanhoe
	Mines of $388.0&#160;million. The financing increased Rio
	Tinto&#146;s equity ownership at that time in Ivanhoe Mines from
	9.9% to 19.7%. The proceeds of $388.0&#160;million will be used
	to help build and commission the open-pit mine at Oyu Tolgoi and
	to advance development of the underground block-cave mine.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Under the current agreement with Ivanhoe Mines, Rio Tinto has
	rights to subscribe for common shares from Ivanhoe Mines&#146;
	representing up to 44.3% of Ivanhoe Mines and, during the next
	19&#160;months, Rio Tinto may increase this stake to a maximum
	of 46.6% through purchases on the open market.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Ivanhoe
	Mines and Rio Tinto signed long-term Investment Agreement with
	the Mongolian Government to build and operate Oyu
	Tolgoi
</FONT>
</I>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	On October&#160;6, 2009, Ivanhoe Mines, with its subsidiary, Oyu
	Tolgoi LLC (OT LLC)(formerly Ivanhoe Mines Mongolia Inc.
	LLC)&#160;and its strategic partner, Rio Tinto, signed and
	approved the long-awaited Investment Agreement with the
	Government of Mongolia. The agreement established a
	comprehensive framework for maintaining a stable tax and
	operating environment for the construction and operation of the
	Oyu Tolgoi Project. The signing, at a nationally-televised state
	ceremony, culminated nine years of exploration successes that
	have established Oyu Tolgoi as one of the world&#146;s largest,
	undeveloped copper-gold porphyry projects, and nearly six years
	of negotiations with the Government of Mongolia for an
	Investment Agreement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The Government will acquire a 34% interest in Oyu Tolgoi&#146;s
	licence holder, OT LLC, and Ivanhoe Mines will retain a
	controlling 66% interest in OT LLC. Provisions of the Investment
	Agreement include protection of the parties&#146; investments in
	the Oyu Tolgoi Project, the amount and term of the parties&#146;
	investments in the Oyu Tolgoi Project, the right to realize the
	benefits of such investments, the conduct of mining with minimum
	environmental impact and progressive rehabilitation, the social
	and economic development of the South Gobi Region and the
	training and employment of thousands of new workers in Mongolia.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The Shareholders&#146; Agreement, which was also signed and
	approved on October&#160;6, 2009, established the basis upon
	which the Government of Mongolia will, through its
	wholly-state-owned company, Erdenes MGL LLC (Erdenes), acquire
	and hold the initial 34% equity interest in OT LLC and provides
	for the respective rights and obligations of the parties as
	shareholders of OT LLC. The Shareholders&#146; Agreement also
	addresses the
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PARAGRAPH PAGEBREAK -->
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	6
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage155"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
<A HREF="#O59368EXV3_HTM_TOCPAGE">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
<BR>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION
	AND
<BR>
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
<BR>
	(Stated in U.S. dollars, except where noted)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	circumstances and the requirements pursuant to which Ivanhoe
	Mines and Rio Tinto will arrange financing for Erdenes&#146;
	portion of the investment capital needed for the Project.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	A
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP">
	50-year
</FONT>
	assurance of stability
</FONT>
</I>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Given the extent of the mineral discoveries associated with the
	Oyu Tolgoi Project and the potential for additional discoveries,
	Ivanhoe Mines and the Government of Mongolia agreed that the
	approved Investment Agreement should conform with
	Mongolia&#146;s current Minerals Law specifying that certain
	deposits of strategic importance qualify for 30&#160;years of
	stabilized tax rates and regulatory provisions, with an option
	of extending the term of the Investment Agreement for an
	additional 20&#160;years.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Major taxes and rates stabilized for the life of the Investment
	Agreement include: corporate income tax, customs duty,
	value-added tax; excise tax; royalties; exploration and mining
	licences; and immovable property
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP">
	and/or
</FONT>
	real
	estate tax.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	OT LLC also will receive a 10% investment tax credit on all
	capital expenditures and investments made throughout the initial
	Oyu Tolgoi construction period. Any future taxes introduced will
	not be imposed on the Project unless future legislation is more
	favourable, in which case Ivanhoe Mines may request the more
	favourable treatment. If Mongolia enters a tax or bilateral
	treaty that provides greater benefits to the investor, Ivanhoe
	Mines may request the benefit of such law, regulation or treaty
	to help ensure that a stable taxation and operating environment
	is maintained. In addition, Ivanhoe Mines will have the
	opportunity to apply a favourable loss-carry-forward benefit to
	the Project as previously enacted into law by Parliament and
	clarified for application to the Project by the Investment
	Agreement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	The
	Mongolian Government will join Ivanhoe Mines and Rio Tinto as a
	partner in Oyu Tolgoi
</FONT>
</I>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Mongolia&#146;s state-owned company, Erdenes, will acquire a 34%
	interest in the Oyu Tolgoi Project within 14&#160;days of the
	approved Investment Agreement taking effect.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Noteworthy provisions of the approved Investment Agreement and
	Shareholders&#146; Agreement also include:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	Ivanhoe Mines will arrange financing for the construction of Oyu
	Tolgoi within two years of the Investment Agreement taking
	effect. Production must begin within five years of financing
	being secured.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	Ivanhoe Mines will fund the construction of the Oyu Tolgoi
	Project through loans and equity obtained during the
	construction and initial production periods. Ivanhoe Mines will
	receive loan repayments, redemption of equity, dividends and
	interest at a rate of 9.9% adjusted to the US CPI.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	Erdenes is entitled to nominate three directors and Ivanhoe
	Mines will nominate six directors to the nine-member board of
	directors of OT LLC.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	Ivanhoe Mines will nominate the management team that will be
	responsible for Oyu Tolgoi&#146;s core operations. Management
	services payments will be received, based on capital and
	operating costs, through the construction period and after
	production begins.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	The Government has the option to purchase an additional equity
	interest of 16% of OT LLC, at an agreed upon fair-market value,
	one year after the expiry of the initial
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP">
	30-year
</FONT>
	term
	of the Investment Agreement and following the start of the
	permitted
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP">
	20-year
</FONT>
	extension. If exercised, this additional equity interest would
	give the Government a total maximum interest of 50% of OT LLC
	for the remainder of the Oyu Tolgoi Project&#146;s operational
	life. Ivanhoe Mines would continue to hold management rights
	over the project and hold a deciding vote at board and
	shareholder meetings.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	7
</DIV>
