</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	B.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<A NAME='O59368EXV3_HTM_104'>
</A>
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	DISCONTINUED
	OPERATIONS
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	This category is comprised of Ivanhoe Mines&#146; discontinued
	operations of the Savage River iron ore mine in Tasmania,
	Australia, and SouthGobi&#146;s discontinued Mamahak coal
	project in Indonesia.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Savage
	River, Tasmania, Australia
</FONT>
</I>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In February 2005, Ivanhoe Mines sold its Savage River mining
	operations in Tasmania, Australia, for two initial cash payments
	totalling $21.5&#160;million, plus a series of five contingent,
	annual payments that commenced on March&#160;31, 2006.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The first contingent annual payment of $28.2&#160;million was
	received by Ivanhoe Mines in 2006, the second contingent annual
	payment of $20.3&#160;million was received in 2007 and the third
	contingent annual payment of $29.2&#160;million was received in
	2008.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	On April&#160;1, 2009, Ivanhoe Mines received an amount of
	$37.0&#160;million in relation to the fourth annual contingent
	payment and a further $1.7&#160;million was received in
	Q3&#146;09.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	To date, Ivanhoe Mines has received $137.9&#160;million in
	proceeds from the sale of Savage River.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	At December&#160;31, 2009, Ivanhoe Mines had accrued a
	$20.9&#160;million receivable in relation to the fifth
	contingent annual payment due in March 2010. This amount is
	calculated based upon the actual tonnes of iron ore sold during
	the nine-month period ended December&#160;31, 2009, and the
	escalating price formula.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Mamahak
	Project, Indonesia
</FONT>
</I>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	During 2009, as SouthGobi progressed with efforts to prepare for
	the mining and shipment of the targeted 30,000-tonne trial cargo
	from its Mamahak Deposit in Indonesia, SouthGobi became aware of
	the requirement for additional capital expenditure beyond what
	originally had been budgeted to develop the project. After
	reviewing the project expenditures and related budgets,
	SouthGobi suspended further development works at Mamahak pending
	a detailed operational review and analysis. As a result of the
	suspension, SouthGobi recorded an impairment of
	$23.3&#160;million for the Mamahak Project in Q3&#146;09.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In December 2009, SouthGobi sold its 85% interest in the Mamahak
	Deposit to Kangaroo Resources Limited (Kangaroo), an Australian
	mining company, for consideration comprising US$1.0&#160;million
	in cash and 50&#160;million shares of Kangaroo.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The divestment of its 85% interest in the Mamahak Project will
	enable SouthGobi to focus on its Mongolian coal operations and
	projects.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="96%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	C.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<A NAME='O59368EXV3_HTM_105'>
</A>
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	ADMINISTRATIVE
	AND OTHER
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	General and administrative
	costs.
</I>
	&#160;&#160;Administrative costs in 2009 were
	$45.8&#160;million, an increase of $18.3&#160;million from 2008
	($27.5&#160;million). The increase includes an additional
	$5.2&#160;million non-cash stock
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PARAGRAPH PAGEBREAK -->
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	18
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage167"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
<A HREF="#O59368EXV3_HTM_TOCPAGE">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
<BR>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION
	AND
<BR>
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
<BR>
	(Stated in U.S. dollars, except where noted)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	compensation expense related mainly to options granted during
	2009, an additional $2.0&#160;million in travel costs and an
	increase of $7.7&#160;million in general consulting costs.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	Interest income.
</I>
	&#160;&#160;Interest income in 2009 of
	$3.6&#160;million was $9.6&#160;million less than 2008
	($13.2&#160;million) primarily due to significantly lower
	interest rates being achieved in 2009.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	Interest expense.
</I>
	&#160;&#160;Interest expense in 2009 of
	$21.6&#160;million was $4.0&#160;million more than 2008
	($17.6&#160;million) due to $4.7&#160;million in interest being
	incurred by SouthGobi on the November 2009 convertible debenture
	issued to CIC. Ivanhoe Mines incurred $16.2&#160;million in
	interest on its convertible credit facility with Rio Tinto
	(2008: $17.1&#160;million)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	Foreign exchange gain.
</I>
	&#160;&#160;The $34.1&#160;million
	foreign exchange gain during 2009 was mainly attributable to the
	strengthening of the Canadian and Australian dollars against the
	U.S.&#160;dollar during the year. The majority of this foreign
	exchange gain was unrealized at December&#160;31, 2009.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	Share of loss on significantly influenced
	investees.
</I>
	&#160;&#160;The $45.9&#160;million share of loss
	on significant influenced investees in 2009 represents Ivanhoe
	Mines&#146; share of Exco&#146;s ($1.2&#160;million) and
	Altynalmas Gold&#146;s net loss ($44.7&#160;million). Ivanhoe
	Mines share of loss on significantly influenced investees in
	2008 was $10.1&#160;million.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	Change in fair value of embedded derivatives in convertible
	debenture.
</I>
	&#160;&#160;The $45.0&#160;million change in fair
	value of embedded derivatives in convertible debenture relates
	to the SouthGobi convertible debenture issued to CIC in November
	2009. The conversion features are considered embedded derivative
	liabilities that must be recorded at their fair value upon
	initial measurement and revalued at each subsequent reporting
	period.
</DIV>
<A NAME='O59368EXV3_HTM_106'>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
</DIV>
<A NAME='O59368EXV3_HTM_107'>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	FOURTH
	QUARTER
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	Revenue.
</I>
	&#160;&#160;In Q4&#146;09, SouthGobi recognized
	$9.9&#160;million in coal revenue, compared to $3.1&#160;million
	in 2008. SouthGobi shipped approximately 359,000 tonnes of coal
	in Q4&#146;09 at an average realized selling price of
	approximately $29 per tonne, compared to 113,000 tonnes of coal
	in Q4&#146;08 at an average realized selling price of
	approximately $29 per tonne.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	Exploration.
</I>
	&#160;&#160;In Q4&#146;09, Ivanhoe Mines
	expensed $67.2&#160;million in exploration and development
	activities, compared to $73.0&#160;million in Q4&#146;08. The
	majority of the $67.2&#160;million was spent on the Mongolian
	properties ($50.7&#160;million in Q4&#146;09, compared to
	$62.1&#160;million in Q4&#146;08). Approximately
	$42.3&#160;million was spent on the Oyu Tolgoi Project,
	$7.4&#160;million was spent on SouthGobi&#146;s Mongolian coal
	projects and $15.1&#160;million was spent by Ivanhoe Australia.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	Administrative costs.
</I>
	&#160;&#160;Administrative costs in
	Q4&#146;09 were $15.0&#160;million, an increase of
	$6.9&#160;million from Q4&#146;08 ($8.1&#160;million). The
	increase was due to a $1.4&#160;million increase in non-cash
	stock based compensation related mainly to options granted
	during Q4&#146;09 and a general increase in travel, salaries and
	consulting costs.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	Foreign exchange gain.
</I>
	&#160;&#160;The $2.1&#160;million
	foreign exchange gain during Q4&#146;09 was attributable to the
	strengthening of the Canadian and Australian dollars against the
	U.S.&#160;dollar. The majority of this foreign exchange gain was
	unrealized at December&#160;31, 2009.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	Change in fair value of embedded derivatives in convertible
	debenture.
</I>
	&#160;&#160;The $45.0&#160;million change in fair
	value of embedded derivatives in convertible debenture relates
	to the SouthGobi convertible debenture issued to CIC in November
	2009. The conversion features are considered embedded derivative
	liabilities that must be recorded at their fair value upon
	initial measurement and revalued at each subsequent reporting
	period.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	Writedown of other long-term investments.
</I>
	&#160;&#160;The
	$18.0&#160;million write-down of other long-term investments in
	Q4&#146;08 represents the additional impairment recorded on the
	Company&#146;s Long-term Notes.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	20
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
<BR>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION
	AND
<BR>
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
<BR>
	(Stated in U.S. dollars, except where noted)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<A NAME='O59368EXV3_HTM_108'>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	LIQUIDITY
	AND CAPITAL RESOURCES
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Cash
	Flow
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	Operating activities.
</I>
	&#160;&#160;The $183.3&#160;million
	of cash used in operating activities in 2009 primarily was the
	result of $155.1&#160;million in cash exploration expenditures,
	a $7.5&#160;million change in non-cash operating working capital
	and $19.2&#160;million of cash used in discontinued operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	Investing activities.
</I>
	&#160;&#160;The $190.3&#160;million
	of cash used in investing activities in 2009 included
	$15.0&#160;million purchased in short-term investments,
	$30.4&#160;million in long-term investments and
	$147.5&#160;million purchased in other long-term investments.
	The $147.5&#160;million of other long-term investments purchased
	consisted mainly of the $100.0&#160;million Mongolian Treasury
	Bill purchased by OT LLC and $47.5&#160;million in long-term
	money market instruments purchased by SouthGobi. There also was
	$39.0&#160;million used in property, plant and equipment
	purchases mainly relating to Ovoot Tolgoi. These outflows were
	slightly offset by the receipt of $38.7&#160;million as part of
	the fourth annual payment from the sale of the Savage River
	operation.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<I>
	Financing activities.
</I>
	&#160;&#160;The $912.6&#160;million
	in cash provided by financing activities was mainly attributable
	to $388.0&#160;million received from the exercise by Rio Tinto
	of Tranche&#160;2 of the 2006 Private Placement,
	$485.0&#160;million raised by SouthGobi upon issue of the
	convertible debenture to CIC and $37.6&#160;million drawn down
	from credit facilities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Liquidity
	and Capital Resources
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	At December&#160;31, 2009, Ivanhoe Mines&#146; consolidated
	working capital was $597.9&#160;million, including cash and cash
	equivalents of $965.8&#160;million, compared with working
	capital of $401.9&#160;million and cash and cash equivalents of
	$384.1&#160;million at December&#160;31, 2008. Included in the
	December&#160;31, 2009, cash and cash equivalents balance of
	$965.8&#160;million was $357.3&#160;million of SouthGobi&#146;s
	cash and cash equivalents and $10.6&#160;million of Ivanhoe
	Australia&#146;s cash and cash equivalents, which were not
	available for the Company&#146;s use.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	As at March&#160;31, 2009, Ivanhoe Mines&#146; current
	consolidated cash position was approximately $1.3&#160;billion.
	Ivanhoe Mines, based on its current cash position, believes that
	its existing funds should be sufficient to fund its minimum
	obligations, including general corporate activities, for at
	least the next 12&#160;months.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Ivanhoe Mines is advancing its financing plan for the Oyu Tolgoi
	Project. Ivanhoe Mines&#146; current consolidated cash position,
	together with the future proceeds from the expected exercise by
	Rio Tinto of its Ivanhoe Mines warrants and rights, for a total
	of $1.2&#160;billion, will provide the foundation for the
	funding of the Oyu Tolgoi Project.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In January 2010, Ivanhoe Mines announced that it had retained
	leading global investment banking firm Citi and independent
	mining sector specialist Hatch Corporate Finance (Hatch) to
	evaluate and advise the Company on a range of strategic options
	to further enhance shareholder value. Citi and Hatch will assist
	the Company&#146;s management to evaluate a range of options
	during the coming months. Options include, but are not limited
	to, potential debt/equity offerings, a credit facility, the sale
	of subsidiaries, equity investments, project financing
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP">
	and/or
</FONT>
	various corporate transactions. No specific transaction is being
	considered at this time.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Ivanhoe Mines has begun to assess the availability of debt
	financing for the development of Oyu Tolgoi. Discussions are
	being held with potential project lenders with the intention of
	raising funds in 2010. Based on that review, the Company
	believes that the remaining funding requirements for the Project
	can be fulfilled primarily through debt. Numerous
	sovereign-wealth funds, international banks and multilateral
	agencies have made unsolicited approaches to Ivanhoe Mines and
	expressed direct interest in participating in project financing
	arrangements.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	21
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage170"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
<A HREF="#O59368EXV3_HTM_TOCPAGE">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
<BR>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION
	AND
<BR>
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
<BR>
	(Stated in U.S. dollars, except where noted)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Financial
	Instruments
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Ivanhoe Mines&#146; financial instruments consist of cash and
	cash equivalents, short-term investments, accounts receivable,
	long-term investments, other long-term investments, accounts
	payable, amounts due under credit facilities and convertible
	credit facilities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The fair value of Ivanhoe Mines&#146; long-term investments was
	determined by reference to published market quotations, which
	may not be reflective of future values.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The fair value of Ivanhoe Mines&#146; other long-term
	investments, consisting of the Long-Term Notes, the Mongolian
	Treasury Bill and long-term money market instruments was
	determined by considering the best available data regarding
	market conditions for such investments, which may not be
	reflective of future values.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The fair value of the Rio Tinto convertible credit facility was
	estimated to approximate the balance of principal and interest
	outstanding, due primarily to the short-term maturity of this
	facility.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The fair value of the CIC convertible debenture was estimated to
	approximate the aggregate carrying amount of the CIC convertible
	credit facility liability and interest payable. This aggregate
	carrying amount includes the estimated fair value of the
	embedded derivative liability which was determined using a Monte
	Carlo simulation valuation model.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The fair values of Ivanhoe Mines&#146; remaining financial
	instruments were estimated to approximate their carrying values,
	due primarily to the immediate or short-term maturity of these
	financial instruments.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Ivanhoe Mines is exposed to credit risk with respect to its
	accounts receivable. The significant concentrations of credit
	risk are situated in Mongolia and Australia. Ivanhoe Mines does
	not mitigate the balance of this risk in light of the credit
	worthiness of its major debtors.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Ivanhoe Mines is exposed to interest rate risk with respect to
	the variable rates of interest incurred on the Rio Tinto
	convertible credit facility and amounts due under credit
	facilities. Interest rate risk is concentrated in Canada.
	Ivanhoe Mines does not mitigate the balance of this risk.
</DIV>
<A NAME='O59368EXV3_HTM_109'>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">

	At March&#160;31, 2010, the Company had a total of:
</DIV>

<A NAME='O59368EXV3_HTM_110'>

	&nbsp;

<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	OUTLOOK
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The information below is in addition to the disclosure
	concerning specific operations included in the Review of
	Operations section of this MD&#038;A.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The Company has worked with the Government of Mongolia to
	satisfy the remaining conditions precedent to the approved
	Investment Agreement. On March&#160;31, 2010, the Mongolian
	Government confirmed that the procedural and administrative
	conditions contained in the Investment Agreement had been
	satisfied within the allocated six-month period that has
	followed the agreement&#146;s official signing on
	October&#160;6, 2009. The comprehensive Investment Agreement now
	has taken full legal effect.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	As a result, the Company:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	expects to shortly fully implement the 2010 construction budget;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	expects to purchase a second T-Bill from the Government of
	Mongolia within 14&#160;days of the approved Investment
	Agreement taking effect.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	will transfer to Mongolia&#146;s state-owned company, Erdenes, a
	34% interest in the Oyu Tolgoi Project within 14&#160;days of
	the approved Investment Agreement taking effect.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	General
	Economic Conditions
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The markets in which Ivanhoe Mines expects to sell its products
	have seen significant improvements during the year. Prices for
	base and precious metal prices increased significantly in 2009.
	There has been increased demand for coal, particularly in Asia.
	While world-wide economic conditions continue to improve and
	stability appears to be returning to financial and commodity
	markets, there continues to be significant concern about the
	short- and medium-term global economic outlook. Specifically,
	the cost of obtaining capital has increased and there continues
	to be limited availability of funds. Accordingly, management is
	reviewing the effects of the current conditions on Ivanhoe
	Mines&#146; business.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	23
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<P>
<A NAME="eolPage172"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
<A HREF="#O59368EXV3_HTM_TOCPAGE">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
<BR>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION
	AND
<BR>
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
<BR>
	(Stated in U.S. dollars, except where noted)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Exchange
	rates
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The sale of Ivanhoe Mines&#146; coal products are denominated in
	US dollars.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Ivanhoe Mines holds a portion of its cash resources in
	currencies other than the US$. Ivanhoe Mines expects to incur
	future expenditures in currencies other than the US$, most
	notably in Canadian and Australian dollars. As a result,
	exchange gains and losses from holding Canadian and Australian
	dollars primarily are unrealized and are expected to continue to
	fluctuate significantly given the recent volatility in foreign
	exchange rates.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Capital
	Expenditures
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Ivanhoe Mines continues to review its capital spending in light
	of current market conditions.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In late 2009, the joint Ivanhoe Mines-Rio Tinto Oyu Tolgoi
	Technical Committee conditionally approved a $758.0&#160;million
	budget for 2010 to begin full-scale construction of the Oyu
	Tolgoi mining complex. The budget for 2010 includes Ivanhoe
	Mines repurchase from Rio Tinto of $195.4&#160;million of key
	mining and milling equipment that was financed by the sale of
	15&#160;million shares to Rio Tinto at a price of $16.07 per
	share (C$16.31 per share) for proceeds of $241.1&#160;million
	(C$244.7&#160;million).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The 2010 budget provides for an early start on a site-wide
	development program at Oyu Tolgoi.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	See &#147;Liquidity and Capital Resources&#148; for more
	information on Ivanhoe Mines&#146; financing plans for the Oyu
	Tolgoi Project.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Other
	information
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The Company is actively involved in advancing several other
	projects. These activities are expected to continue in 2010,
	with a focus on subsidiary SouthGobi and its mining of coal;
	subsidiary Ivanhoe Australia and its activities on its Cloncurry
	tenements and its Tennant Creek joint-venture; and Altynalmas
	Gold and its drilling program at the Kyzyl Gold Project.
	SouthGobi and Ivanhoe Australia have sufficient funds to advance
	their operations and development plans for 2009. Ivanhoe Mines
	owns 50% of Altynalmas Gold, which is reviewing its operating
	plans to determine the amount of funding that it will require
	from its shareholders.
</DIV>
<A NAME='O59368EXV3_HTM_111'>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	OFF-BALANCE-SHEET
	ARRANGEMENTS
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	During the year ended December&#160;31, 2009, Ivanhoe Mines was
	not a party to any off-balance-sheet arrangements that have, or
	are reasonably likely to have, a current or future effect on the
	results of operations, financial condition, revenues or
	expenses, liquidity, capital expenditures or capital resources
	of the Company.
</DIV>
<A NAME='O59368EXV3_HTM_112'>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>

	Table of Contents

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
<BR>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION
	AND
<BR>
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
<BR>
	(Stated in U.S. dollars, except where noted)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; WIDTH: 13%; ALIGN: LEFT; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PT SOLID #000000">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="97%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="TOP">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	These amounts mainly represent various long-term contracts that
	include commitments for future operating payments under
	contracts for drilling, engineering, equipment purchases,
	rentals and other arrangements.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="TOP">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	Debt obligations consist of amounts due under credit facilities
	and convertible credit facilities.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="TOP">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	Other long-term obligations consist of asset retirement
	obligations.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Other contractual or contingent obligations that are not
	included in the above table:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	On October&#160;6, 2009, Ivanhoe Mines&#146; subsidiary, OT LLC
	agreed to purchase three T-Bills from the Government of Mongolia
	having an aggregate face value of $287.5&#160;million, for the
	aggregate sum of $250.0&#160;million. On October&#160;20, 2009,
	OT LLC purchased the initial $100.0&#160;million T-Bill. OT LLC
	is committed to purchase the second $50.0&#160;million T-Bill
	within 14&#160;days of the conditions precedent having been
	addressed and purchase the final $100.0&#160;million T-Bill
	within 14&#160;days of having fully drawn down the financing
	necessary to enable the full and complete construction of the
	Oyu Tolgoi Project or June&#160;30, 2011, whichever date is
	earlier.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	In March 2010, Ivanhoe Mines used $195.4&#160;million of the
	$241.1&#160;million of proceeds received from the issue of
	15.0&#160;million common shares to Rio Tinto to repurchase from
	Rio Tinto certain key mining and milling equipment to be
	installed during the construction of the Oyu Tolgoi Project.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME='O59368EXV3_HTM_113'>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	CHANGES
	IN ACCOUNTING POLICIES
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The Company adopted the FASB Accounting Standards Codification
	(ASC) on July&#160;1, 2009. The ASC becomes the source of
	authoritative U.S.&#160;GAAP to be applied by nongovernmental
	entities. Rules and interpretive releases of the Securities and
	Exchange Commission (SEC) under authority of federal securities
	laws are also sources of authoritative GAAP for SEC registrants.
	The ASC supersedes all non-SEC accounting and reporting
	standards. All other nongrandfathered non-SEC accounting
	literature not included in the ASC will become nonauthoritative.
	The adoption of the ASC had no impact on the Company&#146;s
	consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash
	flows.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In December 2007, the ASC guidance for noncontrolling interests
	was updated to establish accounting and reporting standards
	pertaining to (i)&#160;the nature and classification of the
	noncontrolling interest in the Consolidated Statement of
	Financial Position, (ii)&#160;attributing net income and
	comprehensive income to the parent and the noncontrolling
	interest, (iii)&#160;changes in a parent&#146;s ownership
	interest in a subsidiary, and (iv)&#160;deconsolidation of a
	subsidiary. For presentation and disclosure purposes, the
	updated guidance requires noncontrolling interests to be
	classified as a separate component of shareholders&#146; equity.
	The Company adopted the provisions of the updated guidance on
	January&#160;1, 2009. Except for presentation changes, the
	adoption of the updated guidance had no impact on the
	Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of
	operations or cash flows.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In December 2007, the ASC guidance for business combinations was
	updated. The updated guidance changes accounting for
	acquisitions that close beginning in 2009. More transactions and
	events will qualify as business combinations and will be
	accounted for at fair value under the new standard. The updated
	guidance promotes greater use of fair values in financial
	reporting. Some of the changes will introduce more volatility
	into earnings. The updated guidance was effective for the
	Company&#146;s fiscal year beginning on January&#160;1, 2009.
	The adoption of the updated guidance had no impact on the
	Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of
	operations or cash flows.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In May 2008, ASC guidance for convertible debt instruments was
	updated. The updated guidance applies to convertible debt
	instruments that, by their stated terms, may be settled in cash
	(or other assets) upon conversion, including partial cash
	settlement, unless the embedded conversion option is required to
	be separately accounted for as a derivative. The updated
	guidance requires that the liability and equity components of
	convertible debt instruments within its scope be separately
	accounted for in a manner that reflects the entity&#146;s
	nonconvertible
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PARAGRAPH PAGEBREAK -->
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	25
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>

<A NAME="eolPage174"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
<A HREF="#O59368EXV3_HTM_TOCPAGE">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
<BR>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION
	AND
<BR>
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
<BR>
	(Stated in U.S. dollars, except where noted)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	borrowing rate. This requires an allocation of the convertible
	debt proceeds between the liability component and the embedded
	conversion option (i.e., the equity component). The difference
	between the principal amount of the debt and the amount of the
	proceeds allocated to the liability component will be reported
	as a debt discount and subsequently amortized to earnings over
	the instrument&#146;s expected life using the effective interest
	method. The updated guidance was effective for the
	Company&#146;s fiscal year beginning on January&#160;1, 2009 and
	has been applied retrospectively to all periods presented. The
	adoption of the updated guidance had no impact on the
	Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of
	operations or cash flows.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In October 2008, the ASC guidance for an instrument (or embedded
	feature) with a settlement amount that is based on the stock of
	an entity&#146;s consolidated subsidiary was updated to clarify
	whether such an instrument (or embedded feature) qualifies for
	the scope exemption from derivative accounting. For purposes of
	applying the scope exemption from derivative accounting,
	freestanding financial instruments (and embedded features) for
	which the payoff to the counterparty is based, in whole or in
	part, on the stock of a consolidated subsidiary are not
	precluded from being considered indexed to the entity&#146;s own
	stock in the consolidated financial statements of the parent. An
	equity-classified instrument (including an embedded feature that
	is separately recorded in equity under applicable GAAP) within
	the scope of the updated guidance shall be presented as a
	component of noncontrolling interest in the consolidated
	financial statements whether the instrument was entered into by
	the parent or the subsidiary. The updated guidance was effective
	for the Company&#146;s fiscal year beginning on January&#160;1,
	2009 and has been applied prospectively. The adoption of the
	updated guidance resulted in the reclassification of the fair
	value of the derivative contract to noncontrolling interests on
	January&#160;1, 2009 and any subsequent changes to the fair
	value of the derivative contract will no longer be recorded
	through earnings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In November 2008, the ASC guidance for equity method investment
	accounting was updated. The updated guidance clarifies the
	accounting for certain transactions and impairment
	considerations involving equity method investments. The updated
	guidance provides guidance on a number of factors, including,
	determination of the initial carrying value of an equity method
	investment, performing an impairment assessment of an underlying
	indefinite-lived intangible asset of an equity method
	investment, accounting for an equity method investee&#146;s
	issuance of shares, and accounting for a change in an investment
	from the equity method to the cost method. The updated guidance
	was effective for the Company&#146;s fiscal year beginning on
	January&#160;1, 2009 and has been applied prospectively. The
	adoption of the updated guidance had no impact on the
	Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of
	operations or cash flows.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In April 2009, the ASC guidance was updated to provide
	additional guidance on determining fair value when the volume
	and level of activity for an asset or liability have
	significantly decreased and includes guidance on identifying
	circumstances that indicate when a transaction is not orderly.
	The updated guidance is effective for interim and annual
	reporting periods ending on or after June&#160;15, 2009, and
	shall be applied prospectively. The Company adopted the
	provisions of the updated guidance for the year ended
	December&#160;31, 2009. The adoption of the updated guidance had
	no impact on the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position,
	results of operations or cash flows.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In April 2009, the ASC guidance for interim disclosures about
	fair value was updated to require disclosures about the fair
	value of financial instruments for interim reporting periods of
	publicly traded companies as well as in annual financial
	statements. The updated guidance is effective for interim and
	annual reporting periods ending on or after June&#160;15, 2009.
	The Company adopted the provisions of the updated guidance for
	the year ended December&#160;31, 2009. The adoption of the
	updated guidance had no impact on the Company&#146;s
	consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash
	flows.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	In May 2009, the ASC guidance for subsequent events was updated.
	The updated guidance establishes accounting and reporting
	standards for events that occur after the balance sheet date but
	before financial statements are issued or are available to be
	issued. The updated guidance sets forth (i)&#160;the period
	after the balance sheet date during which management of a
	reporting entity should evaluate events or transactions that may
	occur for potential
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PARAGRAPH PAGEBREAK -->
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	26
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<A HREF="#O59368EXV3_HTM_TOCPAGE">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
<BR>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION
	AND
<BR>
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
<BR>
	(Stated in U.S. dollars, except where noted)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	recognition or disclosure in the financial statements,
	(ii)&#160;the circumstances under which an entity should
	recognize events or transactions occurring after the balance
	sheet in its financial statements, and (iii)&#160;the
	disclosures that an entity should make about events or
	transactions occurring after the balance sheet date in its
	financial statements. The Company adopted the provisions of the
	updated guidance for the year ended December&#160;31, 2009. The
	adoption of the updated guidance had no impact on the
	Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of
	operations or cash flows.
</DIV>
<A NAME='O59368EXV3_HTM_114'>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	CRITICAL
	ACCOUNTING ESTIMATES
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The preparation of financial statements in conformity with
	generally accepted accounting principles in the United States
	requires Ivanhoe Mines to establish accounting policies and to
	make estimates that affect both the amount and timing of the
	recording of assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses. Some of
	these estimates require judgments about matters that are
	inherently uncertain.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	A detailed summary of all of the Company&#146;s significant
	accounting policies and the estimates derived therefrom is
	included in Note&#160;2 to the annual Consolidated Financial
	Statements for the year ended December&#160;31, 2009. While all
	of the significant accounting policies are important to the
	Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements, the following
	accounting policies and the estimates derived therefrom have
	been identified as being critical:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	Carrying Values of Property, Plant and Equipment;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	Depletion and Depreciation of Property, Plant and Equipment;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	Asset Retirement Obligations;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
	&#149;&#160;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
	Income Taxes.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Carrying
	values of Property, Plant and Equipment
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Ivanhoe Mines reviews the carrying values of its property, plant
	and equipment whenever events or changes in circumstances
	indicate that their carrying values may not be recoverable. An
	impairment is considered to exist if total estimated future cash
	flows, or probability-weighted cash flows on an undiscounted
	basis, are less than the carrying value of the assets. An
	impairment loss is measured and recorded based on discounted
	estimated future cash flows associated with values beyond proven
	and probable reserves and resources. In estimating future cash
	flows, assets are grouped at the lowest level for which there is
	identifiable future cash flows that are largely independent of
	cash flows from other asset groups. Generally, in estimating
	future cash flows, all assets are grouped at a particular mine
	for which there is identifiable cash flows.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The estimates used by management are subject to various risks
	and uncertainties. It is reasonably possible that changes in
	estimates could occur which may affect the expected
	recoverability of Ivanhoe Mines&#146; investments in property,
	plant and equipment.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Depletion
	and Depreciation of Property, Plant and Equipment
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Property, plant and equipment comprise one of the largest
	components of Ivanhoe Mines&#146; assets and, as such, the
	amortization of these assets has a significant effect on Ivanhoe
	Mines&#146; financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	On the commencement of commercial production, depletion of each
	mining property is provided on the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP">
	unit-of-production
</FONT>
	basis using estimated proven and probable reserves as the
	depletion basis. The mining plant and equipment and other
	capital assets are depreciated, following the commencement of
	commercial production, over their expected economic lives using
	either the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP">
	unit-of-production
</FONT>
	method or the straight-line method.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	27
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage176"></A>
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
<A HREF="#O59368EXV3_HTM_TOCPAGE">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; MARGIN-LEFT: 6%">
<!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	IVANHOE
	MINES LTD.
<BR>
<BR>
	MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION
	AND
<BR>
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
<BR>
	(Stated in U.S. dollars, except where noted)
</FONT>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK END -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Capital projects in progress are not depreciated until the
	capital asset has been put into operation.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The proven and probable reserves are determined based on a
	professional evaluation using accepted international standards
	for the assessment of mineral reserves. The assessment involves
	the study of geological, geophysical and economic data and the
	reliance on a number of assumptions. The estimates of the
	reserves may change, based on additional knowledge gained
	subsequent to the initial assessment. This may include
	additional data available from continuing exploration, results
	from the reconciliation of actual mining production data against
	the original reserve estimates, or the impact of economic
	factors such as changes in the price of commodities or the cost
	of components of production. A change in the original estimate
	of reserves would result in a change in the rate of depletion
	and depreciation of the related mining assets, or could result
	in impairment, resulting in a write-down of the assets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Asset
	Retirement Obligations
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Ivanhoe Mines has obligations for site restoration and
	decommissioning related to its mining properties. Ivanhoe Mines,
	using mine closure plans or other similar studies that outline
	the requirements planned to be carried out, estimates the future
	obligations for mine closure activities. Because the obligations
	are dependent on the laws and regulations of the countries in
	which the mines operate, the requirements could
	change&#160;&#151; resulting from amendments in those laws and
	regulations relating to environmental protection and other
	legislation affecting resource companies.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Ivanhoe Mines recognizes liabilities for statutory, contractual
	or legal obligations associated with the retirement of property,
	plant and equipment, when those obligations result from the
	acquisition, construction, development or normal operation of
	the assets. Initially, a liability for an asset retirement
	obligation is recognized at its fair value in the period in
	which it is incurred. Upon initial recognition of the liability,
	the corresponding asset retirement cost is added to the carrying
	amount of that asset and the cost is amortized as an expense
	over the economic life of the related asset. Following the
	initial recognition of the asset retirement obligation, the
	carrying amount of the liability is increased for the passage of
	time and adjusted for changes to the amount or timing of the
	underlying cash flows needed to settle the obligation.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	Because the estimate of obligations is based on future
	expectations in the determination of closure provisions,
	management makes a number of assumptions and judgments. The
	closure provisions are more uncertain the further into the
	future the mine closure activities are to be carried out. Actual
	costs incurred in future periods in relation to the remediation
	of Ivanhoe Mines&#146; existing assets could differ materially
	from the $21.9&#160;million undiscounted future value of Ivanhoe
	Mines&#146; estimated asset retirement obligations at
	December&#160;31, 2009.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 2%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES">
	Income
	Taxes
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The Company must make significant estimates in respect of the
	provision for income taxes and the composition of its deferred
	income tax assets and deferred income tax liabilities. Ivanhoe
	Mines&#146; operations are, in part, subject to foreign tax laws
	where interpretations, regulations and legislation are complex
	and continually changing. As a result, there are usually some
	tax matters in question which may, on resolution in the future,
	result in adjustments to the amount of deferred income tax
	assets and deferred income tax liabilities, and those
	adjustments may be material to Ivanhoe Mines&#146; financial
	position and results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0%; TEXT-INDENT: 4%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
	The Company computes the provision for deferred income taxes
	under the liability method. Deferred taxes arise from the
	recognition of the tax consequences of temporary differences by
	applying statutory tax rates applicable to future years to
	differences between the financial statement&#146;s carrying
	amounts and the tax bases of certain assets and liabilities. The
	Company records a valuation allowance against any portion of
	those deferred income tax assets that management believes will,
	more likely than not, fail to be realized.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL PAGEBREAK BEGIN -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES; COLOR: #000000; BACKGROUND: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
	28
</DIV>
<!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
